senator lodge and gentlemen of the notification committee
 the message which you bring to i be one of signal honor it be also a summon to duty a single nomination for the office of president by a great party which in 32 year out of 40 have be triumphant at national election be a distinction which i gratefully cherish to receive unanimous renomination by the same party be an expression of regard and a pledge of continue confidence for which it be difficult to make adequate acknowledgment
 if anything exceed the honor of the office of president of the united states it be the responsibility which attach to it having be invest with both i do not underappraise either any one who have bear the anxiety and burden of the presidential office especially in time of national trial can not contemplate assume it a second time without profoundly realize the severe exaction and the solemn obligation which it impose and this feeling be accentuate by the momentous problem which now press for settlement if my countryman shall confirm the action of the convention at our national election in november i shall crave divine guidance undertake the exalt trust to administer it for the interest and honor of the country and the well being of the new people who have become the object of our care the declaration of principle adopt by the convention have my hearty approval at some future date i will consider its subject in detail and will by letter communicate to your chairman a more formal acceptance of the nomination
 on a like occasion four year ago i say
 the party that supply by legislation the vast revenue for the conduct of our great war that promptly restore the credit of the country at its close that from its abundant revenue pay off a large share of the debt incur by this war and that resume specie payment and place our paper currency upon a sound and endure basis can be safely trust to preserve both our credit and currency with honor stability and inviolability the american people hold the financial honor of our government as sacred as our flag and can be rely upon to guard it with the same sleepless vigilance they hold its preservation above party fealty and have often demonstrate that party tie avail nothing when the spotless credit of our country be threaten
 the dollar pay to the farmer the wage earner and the pensioner must continue forever equal in purchasing and debt pay power to the dollar pay to any government creditor
 our industrial supremacy our productive capacity our business and commercial prosperity our labor and its reward our national credit and currency our proud financial honor and our splendid free citizenship the birthright of every american be all involve in the pende campaign and thus every home in the land be directly and intimately connect with their proper settlement
 our domestic trade must be win back and our idle work people employ in gainful occupation at american wage our home market must be restore to its proud rank of first in the world and our foreign trade so precipitately cut off by adverse national legislation reopen on fair and equitable term for our surplus agricultural and manufacturing product
 public confidence must be resume and the skill energy and capital of our country find ample employment at home the government of the united states must raise money enough to meet both its current expense and increase need its revenue should be so raise as to protect the material interest of our people with the light possible drain upon their resource and maintain that high standard of civilization which have distinguish our country for more than a century of its existence
 the national credit which have thus far fortunately resist every assault upon it must and will be uphold and strengthen if sufficient revenue be provide for the support of the government there will be no necessity for borrow money and increase the public debt
 three and one half year of legislation and administration have be conclude since these word be speak have those to whom be confide the direction of the government keep their pledge the record be make up the people be not unfamiliar with what have be accomplish the gold standard have be reaffirm and strengthen the endless chain have be break and the drain upon our gold reserve no long fret we the credit of the country have be advance to the high place among all nation we be refund our bond debt bear 3 and 4 and 5 per cent interest at 2 per cent a low rate than that of any other country and already more than $ 300,000,000 have be fund with a gain to the government of many million of dollar instead of 16 to 1 for which our opponent contend four year ago legislation have be enact which while utilize all form of our money secure one fix value for every dollar and that the well know to the civilized world
 a tariff which protect american labor and industry and provide ample revenue have be write in public law we have low interest and high wage more money and few mortgage the world&#39;s market have be open to american product which go now where they have never go before we have pass from a bond issue to a bond pay nation from a nation of borrower to a nation of lender from a deficiency in revenue to a surplus from fear to confidence from enforce idleness to profitable employment the public faith have be uphold public order have be maintain we have prosperity at home and prestige abroad
 unfortunately the threat of 1896 have just be renew by the allied party without abatement or modification the gold bill have be denounce and its repeal demand the menace of 16 to 1 therefore still hang over we with all its dire consequence to credit and confidence to business and industry the enemy of sound currency be rally their scatter force the people must once more unite and overcome the advocate of repudiation and must not relax their energy until the battle for public honor and honest money shall again triumph
 a congress which will sustain and if need be strengthen the present law can prevent a financial catastrophe which every lover of the republic be interested to avert
 not satisfied with assault the currency and credit of the government our political adversary condemn the tariff enact at the extra session of congress in 1897 know as the dingley act pass in obedience to the will of the people express at the election in the precede november a law which at once stimulate our industry open the factory and mine and give to the laborer and to the farmer fair return for their toil and investment shall we go back to a tariff which bring deficiency in our revenue and destruction to our industrial enterprise
 faithful to its pledge in these internal affair how have the government discharge its international duty
 our platform of 1896 declare the hawaiian islands should be control by the united states and no foreign power should be permit to interfere with they this purpose have be fully accomplish by annexation and delegate from those beautiful island have participate in the declaration for which you speak today in the great conference of nation at the hague we reaffirm before the world the monroe doctrine and our adherence to it and our determination not to participate in the complication of europe we have happily end the european alliance in samoa secure to ourselves one of the most valuable harbor in the pacific ocean while the open door in china give to we fair and equal competition in the vast trade of the orient
 some thing have happen which be not promise nor even foresee and our purpose in relation to they must not be leave in doubt a just war have be wage for humanity and with it have come new problem and responsibility spain have be eject from the western hemisphere and our flag float over her former territory cuba have be liberate and our guarantee to her people will be sacredly execute a beneficent government have be provide for porto rico the philippines be ours and american authority must be supreme throughout the archipelago there will be amnesty broad and liberal but no abatement of our right no abandonment of our duty there must be no scuttle policy we will fulfill in the philippines the obligation impose by the triumph of our arm and by the treaty of peace by international law by the nation&#39;s sense of honor and more than all by the right interest and condition of the philippine people themselves
 no outside interference block the way to peace and a stable government the obstructionist be here not elsewhere they may postpone but they can not defeat the realization of the high purpose of this nation to restore order to the island and to establish a just and generous government in which the inhabitant shall have the large participation for which they be capable
 the organize force which have be mislead into rebellion have be disperse by our faithful soldier and sailor and the people of the island deliver from anarchy pillage and oppression recognize american sovereignty as the symbol and pledge of peace justice law religious freedom education the security of life and property and the welfare and prosperity of their several community
 we reassert the early principle of the republican party sustain by unbroken judicial precedent that the representatives of the people in congress assemble have full legislative power over territory belong to the united states subject to the fundamental safeguard of liberty justice and personal right and be vest with ample authority to act for the high interest of our nation and the people intrust to its care this doctrine first proclaim in the cause of freedom will never be use as a weapon for oppression i be glad to be assure by you that what we have do in the far east have the approval of the country
 the sudden and terrible crisis in china call for the grave consideration and you will not expect from i now any further expression than to say that my good effort shall be give to the immediate purpose of protect the life of our citizen who be in peril with the ultimate object of the peace and welfare of china the safeguarding of all our treaty right and the maintenance of those principle of impartial intercourse to which the civilized world be pledge
 i can not conclude without congratulate my countryman upon the strong national sentiment which find expression in every part of our common country and the increase respect with which the american name be greet throughout the world we have be move in untried path but our step have be guide by honor and duty there will be no turning aside no wavering no retreat no blow have be strike except for liberty and humanity and none will be we will perform without fear every national and international obligation
 the republican party be dedicate to freedom forty four year ago it have be the party of liberty and emancipation from that hour not of profession but of performance it break the shackle of 4,000,000 slave and make they free and to the party of lincoln have come another supreme opportunity which it have bravely meet in the liberation of 10,000,000 of the human family from the yoke of imperialism
 in its solution of great problem in its performance of high duty it have have the support of member of all party in the past and confidently invoke their cooperation in the future

to the senate and house of representatives at the outgoing of the old and the incoming of the new century you begin the last session of the fifty sixth congress with evidence on every hand of individual and national prosperity and with proof of the grow strength and increase power for good of republican institution your countryman will join with you in felicitation that american liberty be more firmly establish than ever before and that love for it and the determination to preserve it be more universal than at any former period of our history the republic be never so strong because never so strongly entrench in the heart of the people as now the constitution with few amendment exist as it leave the hand of its author the addition which have be make to it proclaim large freedom and more extended citizenship popular government have demonstrate in its one hundred and twenty four year of trial here its stability and security and its efficiency as the good instrument of national development and the good safeguard to human right when the sixth congress assemble in november 1800 the population of the united states be 5,308,483.it be now 76,304,799 then we have sixteen state now we have forty five then our territory consist of 909,050 square mile it be now 3,846,595 square mile education religion and morality have keep pace with our advancement in other direction and while extend its power the government have adhere to its foundation principle and abate none of they in deal with our new people and possession a nation so preserve and bless give reverent thank to god and invoke his guidance and the continuance of his care and favor in our foreign intercourse the dominant question have be the treatment of the chinese problem apart from this our relation with the power have be happy the recent trouble in china spring from the antiforeign agitation which for the past three year have gain strength in the northern province their origin lie deep in the character of the chinese race and in the tradition of their government the taiping rebellion and the opening of chinese port to foreign trade and settlement disturb alike the homogeneity and the seclusion of china meanwhile foreign activity make itself feel in all quarter not alone on the coast but along the great river artery and in the remoter district carry new idea and introduce new association among a primitive people which have pursue for century a national policy of isolation the telegraph and the railway spread over their land the steamer ply on their waterway the merchant and the missionary penetrate year by year far to the interior become to the chinese mind type of an alien invasion change the course of their national life and fraught with vague foreboding of disaster to their belief and their self control for several year before the present trouble all the resource of foreign diplomacy back by moral demonstration of the physical force of fleet and arm have be need to secure due respect for the treaty right of foreigner and to obtain satisfaction from the responsible authority for the sporadic outrage upon the person and property of unoffending sojourner which from time to time occur at widely separate point in the northern province as in the case of the outbreak in sze chuen and shan tung posting of antiforeign placard become a daily occurrence which the repeat reprobation of the imperial power fail to check or punish these inflammatory appeal to the ignorance and superstition of the masse mendacious and absurd in their accusation and deeply hostile in their spirit could not but work cumulative harm they aim at no particular class of foreigner they be impartial in attack everything foreign an outbreak in shan tung in which german missionary be slay be the too natural result of these malevolent teaching the posting of seditious placard exhort to the utter destruction of foreigner and of every foreign thing continue unrebuked hostile demonstration toward the stranger gain strength by organization the sect commonly style the boxers develop greatly in the province north of the yang tse and with the collusion of many notable official include some in the immediate council of the throne itself become alarmingly aggressive no foreigner 's life outside of the protect treaty port be safe no foreign interest be secure from spoliation the diplomatic representative of the power in peking strove in vain to check this movement protest be follow by demand and demand by renew protest to be meet with perfunctory edict from the palace and evasive and futile assurance from the tsung li yamen the circle of the boxer influence narrow about peking and while nominally stigmatize as seditious it be feel that its spirit pervade the capital itself that the imperial force be imbue with its doctrine and that the immediate counselor of the empress dowager be in full sympathy with the antiforeign movement the increase gravity of the condition in china and the imminence of peril to our own diversified interest in the empire as well as to those of all the other treaty government be soon appreciate by this government cause it profound solicitude the united states from the early day of foreign intercourse with china have follow a policy of peace omit no occasion to testify good will to further the extension of lawful trade to respect the sovereignty of its government and to insure by all legitimate and kindly but earnest mean the full measure of protection for the life and property of our law abide citizen and for the exercise of their beneficent calling among the chinese people mindful of this it be feel to be appropriate that our purpose should be pronounce in favor of such course as would hasten united action of the power at peking to promote the administrative reform so greatly need for strengthen the imperial government and maintain the integrity of china in which we believe the whole western world to be alike general be enjoin after make themselves familiar with the condition and need of the country to devote their attention in the first instance to the establishment of municipal government in which the native of the island both in the city and in the rural community shall be afford the opportunity to manage their own local affair to the full extent of which they be capable and subject to the least degree of supervision and control which a careful study of their capacity and observation of the working of native control show to be consistent with the maintenance of law order and loyalty the next subject in order of importance should be the organization of government in the large administrative division correspond to county department or province in which the common interest of many or several municipality fail within the same tribal line or the same natural geographical limit may well be subserve by a common administration whenever the commission be of the opinion that the condition of affair in the island be such that the central administration may safely be transfer from military to civil control they will report that conclusion to you with their recommendation as to the form of central government to be establish for the purpose of take over the control begin with the 1st day of september 1900 the authority to exercise subject to my approval through the secretary of war that part of the power of government in the philippine islands which be of a legislative nature be to be transfer from the military governor of the island to this commission to be thereafter exercise by they in the place and stead of the military governor under such rule and regulation as you shall prescribe until the establishment of the civil central government for the island contemplate in the last forego paragraph or until congress shall otherwise provide exercise of this legislative authority will include the making of rule and order have the effect of law for the raising of revenue by taxis custom duty and impost the appropriation and expenditure of public fund of the island the establishment of an educational system throughout t1he island the establishment of a system to secure an efficient civil service the organization and establishment of court the organization and establishment of municipal and departmental government and all other matter of a civil nature for which the military governor be now competent to provide by rule or order of a legislative character the commission will also have power during the same period to appoint to office such officer under the judicial educational and civil service system and in the municipal and departmental government as shall be provide for until the complete transfer of control the military governor will remain the chief executive head of the government of the island and will exercise the executive authority now possess by he and not herein expressly assign to the commission subject however to the rule and order enact by the commission in the exercise of the legislative power confer upon they in the meantime the municipal and departmental government will continue to report to the military governor and be subject to his administrative supervision and control under your direction but that supervision and control will be confine within the narrow limit consistent with the requirement that the power of government in the municipality and department shall be honestly and effectively exercise and that law and order and individual freedom shall be maintain all legislative rule and order establishment of government and appointment to office by the commission will take effect immediately or at such time as they shall designate subject to your approval and action upon the come in of the commission 's report which be to be make from time to time as their action be take wherever civil government be constitute under the direction of the commission such military post garrison and force will be continue for the suppression of insurrection and brigandage and the maintenance of law and order as the military commander shall deem requisite and the military force shall be at all time subject under his order to the call of the civil authority for the maintenance of law and order and the enforcement of their authority in the establishment of municipal government the commission will take as the basis of their work the government establish by the military governor under his order of august 8 1899 and under the report of the board constitute by the military governor by his order of january 29 1900 to formulate and report a plan of municipal government of which his honor cayetano arellano president of the audiencia be chairman and they will give to the conclusion of that board the weight and consideration which the high character and distinguished ability of its member justify in the constitution of departmental or provincial government they will give especial attention to the exist government of the island of negros constitute with the approval of the people of that island under the order of the military governor of july 22 1899 and after verifying so far as may be practicable the report of the successful working of that government they will be guide by the experience thus acquire so far as it may be applicable to the condition exist in other portion of the philippines they will avail themselves to the full degree practicable of the conclusion reach by the previous commission to the philippines in the distribution of power among the government organize by the commission the presumption be always to be in favor of the small subdivision so that all the power which can properly be exercise by the municipal government shall be vest in that government and all the power of a more general character which can be exercise by the departmental government shall be vest in that government and so that in the governmental system which be the result of the process the central government of the island follow the example of the distribution of the power between the states and the national government of the united states shall have no direct administration except of matter of purely general concern and shall have only such supervision and control over local government as may be necessary to secure and enforce faithful and efficient administration by local officer the many different degree of civilization and variety of custom and capacity among the people of the different island preclude very definite instruction as to the part which the people shall take in the selection of their own officer but these general rule be to be observe that in all case the municipal officer who administer the local affair of the people be to be select by the people and that wherever officer of more extended jurisdiction be to be select in any way native of the island be to be prefer and if they can be find competent and willing to perform the duty they be to receive the office in preference to any other it will be necessary to fill some office for the present with americans which after a time may well be fill by native of the island as soon as practicable a system for ascertain the merit and fitness of candidate for civil office should be put in force an indispensable qualification for all office and position of trust and authority in the island must be absolute and unconditional loyalty to the united states and absolute and unhampere authority and power to remove and punish any officer deviate from that standard must at all time be retain in the band of the central authority of the island in all the form of government and administrative provision which they be authorize to prescribe the commission should bear in mind that the government which they be establish be design not for our satisfaction or for the expression of our theoretical view but for the happiness peace and prosperity of tile people of the philippine islands and the measure adopt should be make to conform to their custom their habit and even heir prejudice to the full extent consistent with the accomplishment of the indispensable requisite of just and effective government at the same time the commission should bear in mind and the people of the island should be make plainly to understand that there be certain great principle of government which have be make the basis of our governmental system which we deem essential to the rule of law and the maintenance of individual freedom and of which they have unfortunately be deny the experience possess by we that there be also certain practical rule of government which we have find to be essential to the preservation of these great principle of liberty and law and that these principle and these rule of government must be establish and maintain in their island for the sake of their liberty and happiness however much they may conflict with the custom or law of procedure with which they be familiar it be evident that the most enlightened thought of the philippine islands fully appreciate the importance of these principle and rule and they will inevitably within a short time command universal assent upon every division and branch of the government of the philippines therefore must be impose these inviolable rule that no person shall be deprive of life liberty or property without due process of law that private property shall not be take for public use without just compensation that in all criminal prosecution the accuse shall enjoy the right to a speedy and public trial to be inform of the nature and cause of the accusation to be confront with the witness against he to have compulsory process for obtain witness in his favor and to have the assistance of counsel for his defense that excessive bail shall not be require nor excessive fine impose nor cruel and unusual punishment inflict that no person shall be put twice in jeopardy for the same offense or be compel in any criminal case to be a witness against himself that the right to be secure against unreasonable search and seizure shall not be violate that neither slavery nor involuntary servitude shall exist except as a punishment for crime that no bill of attainder or ex post facto law shall be pass that no law shall be pass abridge the freedom of speech or of the press or the right of the people to peaceably assemble and petition the government for a redress of grievance that no law shall be make respect an establishment of religion or prohibit the free exercise thereof and that the free exercise and enjoyment of religious profession and worship without discrimination or preference shall forever be allow it will be the duty of the commission to make a thorough investigation into the title to the large tract of land hold or claim by individual or by religious order into the justice of the claim and complaint make against stich landholder by the people of the island or any part of the people and to seek by wise and peaceable measure a just settlement of the controversy and redress of wrong which have cause strife and bloodshed in the past in the performance of this duty the commission be enjoin to see that no injustice be do to have regard for substantial right and equity disregard technicality so far as substantial right permit and to observe the follow rule that the provision of the treaty of paris pledge the united states to the protection of all right of property in the island and as well the principle of our own government which prohibit the taking of private property without due process of law shall not be violate that the welfare of the people of the island which should be a paramount consideration shall be attain consistently with this rule of property right that if it become necessary for the public interest of the people of the island to dispose of claim to property which the commission find to be not lawfully acquire and hold disposition shall be make thereof by due legal procedure in which there shall be full opportunity for fair and impartial hearing and judgment that if the same public interest require the extinguishment of property right lawfully acquire and hold due compensation shall be make out of the public treasury therefore that no form of religion and no minister of religion shall be force upon any community or upon any citizen of the island that upon the other hand no minister of religion shall be interfere with or molest in follow his calling and that the separation between state and church shall be real entire and absolute it will be the duty of the commission to promote and extend and as they find occasion to improve the system of education already inaugurate by the military authority in do this they should regard as of first importance the extension of a system of primary education which shall be free to all and which shall tend to fit the people for the duty of citizenship and for the ordinary avocation of a civilized community this instruction should be give in the first instance in every part of the island in the language of the people in view of the great number of language speak by the different tribe it be especially important to the prosperity of the island that a common medium of communication may be establish and it be obviously desirable that this medium should be the english language especial attention should be at once give to afford full opportunity to all the people of the island to acquire the use of the english language it may be well that the main change which should be make in the system of taxation and in the body of the law under which the people be govern except such change as have already be make by the military government should be relegate to the civil government which be to be establish under the auspex of the commission it will however be the duty of the commission to inquire diligently as to whether there be any further change which ought not to be delay and if so they be authorize to make such change subject to your approval in do so they be to bear in mind that taxis which tend 6 penalize or repress industry and enterprise be to be avoid that provision for taxation should be simple so that they may be understand by the people that they should affect the few practicable subject of taxation which will serve for the general distribution of the burden the main body of the law which regulate the right and obligation of the people should be maintain with as little interference as possible change make should be mainly in procedure and in the criminal law to secure speedy and impartial trial and at the same time effective administration and respect for individual right in deal with the uncivilized tribe of the island the commission should adopt the same course follow by congress in permit the tribe of our north american indians to maintain their tribal organization and government and under which many of those tribe be now live in peace and contentment surround by a civilization to which they be unable or unwilling to conform such tribal government should however be subject to wise and firm regulation and without undue or petty interference constant and active effort should be exercise to prevent barbarous practice and introduce civilized custom upon all officer and employee of the united states both civil and military should be impress a sense of the duty to observe not merely the material but the personal and social right of the people of the island and to treat they with the same courtesy and respect for their personal dignity which the people of the united states be accustom w require from each other the article of capitulation of the city of manila on the 13th of august 1898 conclude with these words:"this city its inhabitant its church and religious worship its educational establishment and its private property of all description be place under the special safeguard of the faith and honor of the american army "i believe that this pledge have be faithfully keep as high and sacred an obligation rest upon the government of the united states to give protection for property and life civil and religious freedom and wise firm and unselfish guidance in the path of peace and prosperity to all the people of the philippine islands i charge this commission to labor for the full performance of this obligation which concern the honor and conscience of their country in the firm hope that through their labor all the inhabitant of the philippine islands may come to look back with gratitude to  market price of product and of security be hourly know in every commercial mart and the investment of the people extend beyond their own national boundary into the remotest part of the earth vast transaction be conduct and international exchange be make by the tick of the cable every event of interest be immediately bulletin the quick gathering and transmission of news like rapid transit be of recent origin and be only make possible by the genius of the inventor and the courage of the investor it take a special messenger of the government with every facility know at the time for rapid travel nineteen day to go from the city of washington to new orleans with a message to general jackson that the war with england have cease and a treaty of peace have be sign how different now

 by sensible trade arrangement which will not interrupt our home production we shall extend the outlet for our increase surplus a system which provide a mutual exchange of commodity a mutual exchange be manifestly essential to the continued and healthful growth of our export trade we must not repose in fancied security that we can forever sell everything and buy little or nothing if such a thing be possible it would not be good for we or for those with whom we deal we should take from our customer such of their product as we can use without harm to our industry and labor reciprocity be the natural outgrowth of our wonderful industrial development under the domestic policy now firmly establish what we produce beyond our domestic consumption must have a vent abroad the excess must be relieve through a foreign outlet and we should sell everywhere we can and buy wherever the buying will enlarge our sale and production and thereby make a great demand for home labor

by the president of the united states of america
 a proclamation
 to the people of the united states
 a terrible bereavement have befall our people the president of the united states have be strike down a crime not only against the chief magistrate but against every law abide and liberty love citizen
 president mckinley crown a life of large love for his fellow man of earnest endeavor for their welfare by a death of christian fortitude and both the way in which he live his life and the way in which in the supreme hour of trial he meet his death will remain forever a precious heritage of our people
 it be meet that we as a nation express our abide love and reverence for his life our deep sorrow for his untimely death
 now therefore i theodore roosevelt president of the united states of america do appoint thursday next september 19 the day in which the body of the dead president will be lay in its last earthly resting place as a day of mourning and prayer throughout the united states i earnestly recommend all the people to assemble on that day in their respective place of divine worship there to bow down in submission to the will of almighty god and to pay out of full heart the homage of love and reverence to the memory of the great and good president whose death have so sorely smite the nation
 in witness whereof i have hereunto set my hand and cause the seal of the united states to be affix
 do at the city of washington the fourteenth day of september a. d. 1901 and of the independence of the united states the one hundred and twenty sixth

 theodore roosevelt
 by the president
 john hay
 secretary of state
to the senate and house of representatives

 the congress assemble this year under the shadow of a great calamity on the sixth of september president mckinley be shoot by an anarchist while attend the pan american exposition at buffalo and die in that city on the fourteenth of that month

 of the last seven elect president he be the third who have be murder and the bare recital of this fact be sufficient to justify grave alarm among all loyal american citizen moreover the circumstance of this the third assassination of an american president have a peculiarly sinister significance both president lincoln and president garfield be kill by assassin of type unfortunately not uncommon in history president lincoln fall a victim to the terrible passion arouse by four year of civil war and president garfield to the revengeful vanity of a disappointed office seeker president mckinley be kill by an utterly deprave criminal belong to that body of criminal who object to all government good and bad alike who be against any form of popular liberty if it be guarantee by even the most just and liberal law and who be as hostile to the upright exponent of a free people&#39; sober will as to the tyrannical and irresponsible despot

 it be not too much to say that at the time of president mckinley&#39;s death he be the most widely love man in all the united states while we have never have any public man of his position who have be so wholly free from the bitter animosity incident to public life his political opponent be the first to bear the heartiest and most generous tribute to the broad kindliness of nature the sweetness and gentleness of character which so endear he to his close associate to a standard of lofty integrity in public life he unite the tender affection and home virtue which be all important in the make up of national character a gallant soldier in the great war for the union he also shine as an example to all our people because of his conduct in the most sacred and intimate of home relation there could be no personal hatred of he for he never act with aught but consideration for the welfare of other no one could fail to respect he who know he in public or private life the defender of those murderous criminal who seek to excuse their criminality by assert that it be exercise for political end inveigh against wealth and irresponsible power but for this assassination even this base apology can not be urge

 president mckinley be a man of moderate mean a man whose stock spring from the sturdy tiller of the soil who have himself belong among the wage worker who have enter the army as a private soldier wealth be not strike at when the president be assassinate but the honest toil which be content with moderate gain after a lifetime of unremitting labor largely in the service of the public still less be power strike at in the sense that power be irresponsible or center in the hand of any one individual the blow be not aim at tyranny or wealth it be aim at one of the strong champion the wage worker have ever have at one of the most faithful representative of the system of public right and representative government who have ever rise to public office president mckinley fill that political office for which the entire people vote and no president not even lincoln himself be ever more earnestly anxious to represent the well think out wish of the people his one anxiety in every crisis be to keep in close touch with the people to find out what they think and to endeavor to give expression to their thought after having endeavor to guide that thought aright he have just be reelect to the presidency because the majority of our citizen the majority of our farmer and wage worker believe that he have faithfully uphold their interest for four year they feel themselves in close and intimate touch with he they feel that he represent so well and so honorably all their ideal and aspiration that they wish he to continue for another four year to represent they

 and this be the man at whom the assassin strike that there might be nothing lack to complete the judas like infamy of his act he take advantage of an occasion when the president be meet the people generally and advance as if to take the hand out stretch to he in kindly and brotherly fellowship he turn the noble and generous confidence of the victim into an opportunity to strike the fatal blow there be no base deed in all the annal of crime

 the shock the grief of the country be bitter in the mind of all who see the dark day while the president yet hover between life and death at last the light be still in the kindly eye and the breath go from the lip that even in mortal agony utter no word save of forgiveness to his murderer of love for his friend and of falter trust in the will of the most high such a death crown the glory of such a life leave we with infinite sorrow but with such pride in what he have accomplish and in his own personal character that we feel the blow not as strike at he but as strike at the nation we mourn a good and great president who be dead but while we mourn we be lift up by the splendid achievement of his life and the grand heroism with which he meet his death

 when we turn from the man to the nation the harm do be so great as to excite our grave apprehension and to demand our wise and most resolute action this criminal be a profess anarchist inflame by the teaching of profess anarchist and probably also by the reckless utterance of those who on the stump and in the public press appeal to the dark and evil spirit of malice and greed envy and sullen hatred the wind be sow by the man who preach such doctrine and they can not escape their share of responsibility for the whirlwind that be reap this apply alike to the deliberate demagogue to the exploiter of sensationalism and to the crude and foolish visionary who for whatever reason apologize for crime or excite aimless discontent

 the blow be aim not at this president but at all president at every symbol of government president mckinley be as emphatically the embodiment of the popular will of the nation express through the form of law as a new england town meeting be in similar fashion the embodiment of the law abide purpose and practice of the people of the town on no conceivable theory could the murder of the president be accept as due to protest against inequality in the social order save as the murder of all the freeman engage in a town meeting could be accept as a protest against that social inequality which put a malefactor in jail anarchy be no more an expression of social discontent than pick pocket or wife beating

 the anarchist and especially the anarchist in the united states be merely one type of criminal more dangerous than any other because he represent the same depravity in a great degree the man who advocate anarchy directly or indirectly in any shape or fashion or the man who apologize for anarchist and their deed make himself morally accessory to murder before the fact the anarchist be a criminal whose perverted instinct lead he to prefer confusion and chaos to the most beneficent form of social order his protest of concern for workingmen be outrageous in its impudent falsity for if the political institution of this country do not afford opportunity to every honest and intelligent son of toil then the door of hope be forever close against he the anarchist be everywhere not merely the enemy of system and of progress but the deadly foe of liberty if ever anarchy be triumphant its triumph will last for but one red moment to be succeed for age by the gloomy night of despotism

 for the anarchist himself whether he preach or practice his doctrine we need not have one particle more concern than for any ordinary murderer he be not the victim of social or political injustice there be no wrong to remedy in his case the cause of his criminality be to be find in his own evil passion and in the evil conduct of those who urge he on not in any failure by other or by the state to do justice to he or his he be a malefactor and nothing else he be in no sense in no shape or way a product of social condition save as a highwayman be produce by the fact than an unarmed man happen to have a purse it be a travesty upon the great and holy name of liberty and freedom to permit they to be invoke in such a cause no man or body of man preach anarchistic doctrine should be allow at large any more than if preach the murder of some specified private individual anarchistic speech writing and meeting be essentially seditious and treasonable

 i earnestly recommend to the congress that in the exercise of its wise discretion it should take into consideration the come to this country of anarchist or person profess principle hostile to all government and justify the murder of those place in authority such individual as those who not long ago gather in open meeting to glorify the murder of king humbert of italy perpetrate a crime and the law should ensure their rigorous punishment they and those like they should be keep out of this country and if find here they should be promptly deport to the country whence they come and far reach provision should be make for the punishment of those who stay no matter call more urgently for the wise thought of the congress

 the federal court should be give jurisdiction over any man who kill or attempt to kill the president or any man who by the constitution or by law be in line of succession for the presidency while the punishment for an unsuccessful attempt should be proportion to the enormity of the offense against our institution

 anarchy be a crime against the whole human race and all mankind should band against the anarchist his crime should be make an offense against the law of nation like piracy and that form of man stealing know as the slave trade for it be of far blacker infamy than either it should be so declare by treaty among all civilized power such treaty would give to the federal government the power of deal with the crime

 a grim commentary upon the folly of the anarchist position be afford by the attitude of the law toward this very criminal who have just take the life of the president the people would have tear he limb from limb if it have not be that the law he defy be at once invoke in his behalf so far from his deed be commit on behalf of the people against the government the government be oblige at once to exert its full police power to save he from instant death at the hand of the people moreover his deed work not the slight dislocation in our governmental system and the danger of a recurrence of such deed no matter how great it might grow would work only in the direction of strengthen and give harshness to the force of order no man will ever be restrain from become president by any fear as to his personal safety if the risk to the president&#39;s life become great it would mean that the office would more and more come to be fill by man of a spirit which would make they resolute and merciless in deal with every friend of disorder this great country will not fall into anarchy and if anarchist should ever become a serious menace to its institution they would not merely be stamp out but would involve in their own ruin every active or passive sympathizer with their doctrine the american people be slow to wrath but when their wrath be once kindle it burn like a consume flame

 during the last five year business confidence have be restore and the nation be to be congratulate because of its present abound prosperity such prosperity can never be create by law alone although it be easy enough to destroy it by mischievous law if the hand of the lord be heavy upon any country if flood or drought come human wisdom be powerless to avert the calamity moreover no law can guard we against the consequence of our own folly the man who be idle or credulous the man who seek gain not by genuine work with head or hand but by gamble in any form be always a source of menace not only to themselves but to other if the business world lose its head it lose what legislation can not supply fundamentally the welfare of each citizen and therefore the welfare of the aggregate of citizen which make the nation must rest upon individual thrift and energy resolution and intelligence nothing can take the place of this individual capacity but wise legislation and honest and intelligent administration can give it the full scope the large opportunity to work to good effect

 the tremendous and highly complex industrial development which go on with ever accelerate rapidity during the latter half of the nineteenth century bring we face to face at the beginning of the twentieth with very serious social problem the old law and the old custom which have almost the bind force of law be once quite sufficient to regulate the accumulation and distribution of wealth since the industrial change which have so enormously increase the productive power of mankind they be no long sufficient

 the growth of city have go on beyond comparison fast than the growth of the country and the upbuilding of the great industrial center have mean a startling increase not merely in the aggregate of wealth but in the number of very large individual and especially of very large corporate fortune the creation of these great corporate fortune have not be due to the tariff nor to any other governmental action but to natural cause in the business world operate in other country as they operate in our own

 the process have arouse much antagonism a great part of which be wholly without warrant it be not true that as the rich have grow rich the poor have grow poor on the contrary never before have the average man the wage worker the farmer the small trader be so well off as in this country and at the present time there have be abuse connect with the accumulation of wealth yet it remain true that a fortune accumulate in legitimate business can be accumulate by the person specially benefit only on condition of confer immense incidental benefit upon other successful enterprise of the type which benefit all mankind can only exist if the condition be such as to offer great prize as the reward of success

 the captain of industry who have drive the railway system across this continent who have build up our commerce who have develop our manufacture have on the whole do great good to our people without they the material development of which we be so justly proud could never have take place moreover we should recognize the immense importance of this material development of leave as unhampere as be compatible with the public good the strong and forceful man upon whom the success of business operation inevitably rest the slight study of business condition will satisfy anyone capable of form a judgment that the personal equation be the most important factor in a business operation that the business ability of the man at the head of any business concern big or little be usually the factor which fix the gulf between strike success and hopeless failure

 an additional reason for caution in deal with corporation be to be find in the international commercial condition of to day the same business condition which have produce the great aggregation of corporate and individual wealth have make they very potent factor in international commercial competition business concern which have the large mean at their disposal and be manage by the able man be naturally those which take the lead in the strife for commercial supremacy among the nation of the world america have only just begin to assume that command position in the international business world which we believe will more and more be her it be of the utmost importance that this position be not jeoparde especially at a time when the overflowing abundance of our own natural resource and the skill business energy and mechanical aptitude of our people make foreign market essential under such condition it would be most unwise to cramp or to fetter the youthful strength of our nation

 moreover it can not too often be point out that to strike with ignorant violence at the interest of one set of man almost inevitably endanger the interest of all the fundamental rule in our national life --the rule which underlie all other be that on the whole and in the long run we shall go up or down together there be exception and in time of prosperity some will prosper far more and in time of adversity some will suffer far more than other but speak generally a period of good time mean that all share more or less in they and in a period of hard time all feel the stress to a great or less degree it surely ought not to be necessary to enter into any proof of this statement the memory of the lean year which begin in 1893 be still vivid and we can contrast they with the condition in this very year which be now close disaster to great business enterprise can never have its effect limit to the man at the top it spread throughout and while it be bad for everybody it be bad for those farth down the capitalist may be shorn of his luxury but the wage worker may be deprive of even bare necessity

 the mechanism of modern business be so delicate that extreme care must be take not to interfere with it in a spirit of rashness or ignorance many of those who have make it their vocation to denounce the great industrial combination which be popularly although with technical inaccuracy know as trust appeal especially to hatred and fear these be precisely the two emotion particularly when combine with ignorance which unfit man for the exercise of cool and steady judgment in face new industrial condition the whole history of the world show that legislation will generally be both unwise and ineffective unless undertake after calm inquiry and with sober self restraint much of the legislation direct at the trust would have be exceedingly mischievous have it not also be entirely ineffective in accordance with a well know sociological law the ignorant or reckless agitator have be the really effective friend of the evil which he have be nominally opposing in deal with business interest for the government to undertake by crude and ill consider legislation to do what may turn out to be bad would be to incur the risk of such far reach national disaster that it would be preferable to undertake nothing at all the man who demand the impossible or the undesirable serve as the ally of the force with which they be nominally at war for they hamper those who would endeavor to find out in rational fashion what the wrong really be and to what extent and in what manner it be practicable to apply remedy

 all this be true and yet it be also true that there be real and grave evil one of the chief be over capitalization because of its many baleful consequence and a resolute and practical effort must be make to correct these evil

 there be a widespread conviction in the mind of the american people that the great corporation know as trust be in certain of their feature and tendency hurtful to the general welfare this spring from no spirit of envy or uncharitableness nor lack of pride in the great industrial achievement that have place this country at the head of the nation struggle for commercial supremacy it do not rest upon a lack of intelligent appreciation of the necessity of meeting change and change condition of trade with new method nor upon ignorance of the fact that combination of capital in the effort to accomplish great thing be necessary when the world&#39;s progress demand that great thing be do it be base upon sincere conviction that combination and concentration should be not prohibit but supervise and within reasonable limit control and in my judgment this conviction be right

 it be no limitation upon property right or freedom of contract to require that when man receive from government the privilege of do business under corporate form which free they from individual responsibility and enable they to call into their enterprise the capital of the public they shall do so upon absolutely truthful representation as to the value of the property in which the capital be to be invest corporation engage in interstate commerce should be regulate if they be find to exercise a license work to the public injury it should be as much the aim of those who seek for social- betterment to rid the business world of crime of cunning as to rid the entire body politic of crime of violence great corporation exist only because they be create and safeguard by our institution and it be therefore our right and our duty to see that they work in harmony with these institution

 the first essential in determine how to deal with the great industrial combination be knowledge of the fact publicity in the interest of the public the government should have the right to inspect and examine the working of the great corporation engage in interstate business publicity be the only sure remedy which we can now invoke what further remedy be need in the way of governmental regulation or taxation can only be determine after publicity have be obtain by process of law and in the course of administration the first requisite be knowledge full and complete knowledge which may be make public to the world

 artificial body such as corporation and joint stock or other association depend upon any statutory law for their existence or privilege should be subject to proper governmental supervision and full and accurate information as to their operation should be make public regularly at reasonable interval

 the large corporation commonly call trust though organize in one state always do business in many state often do very little business in the state where they be incorporate there be utter lack of uniformity in the state law about they and as no state have any exclusive interest in or power over their act it have in practice prove impossible to get adequate regulation through state action therefore in the interest of the whole people the nation should without interfere with the power of the states in the matter itself also assume power of supervision and regulation over all corporation do an interstate business this be especially true where the corporation derive a portion of its wealth from the existence of some monopolistic element or tendency in its business there would be no hardship in such supervision bank be subject to it and in their case it be now accept as a simple matter of course indeed it be probable that supervision of corporation by the national government need not go so far as be now the case with the supervision exercise over they by so conservative a state as massachusetts in order to produce excellent result

 when the constitution be adopt at the end of the eighteenth century no human wisdom could foretell the sweeping change alike in industrial and political condition which be to take place by the beginning of the twentieth century at that time it be accept as a matter of course that the several states be the proper authority to regulate so far as be then necessary the comparatively insignificant and strictly localize corporate body of the day the condition be now wholly different and wholly different action be call for i believe that a law can be frame which will enable the national government to exercise control along the line above indicate profit by the experience gain through the passage and administration of the interstate commerce act if however the judgment of the congress be that it lack the constitutional power to pass such an act then a constitutional amendment should be submit to confer the power

 there should be create a cabinet officer to be know as secretary of commerce and industries as provide in the bill introduce at the last session of the congress it should be his province to deal with commerce in its broad sense include among many other thing whatever concern labor and all matter affect the great business corporation and our merchant marine

 the course propose be one phase of what should be a comprehensive and far reach scheme of constructive statesmanship for the purpose of broaden our market secure our business interest on a safe basis and make firm our new position in the international industrial world while scrupulously safeguard the right of wage worker and capitalist of investor and private citizen so as to secure equity as between man and man in this republic

 with the sole exception of the farming interest no one matter be of such vital moment to our whole people as the welfare of the wage worker if the farmer and the wage worker be well off it be absolutely certain that all other will be well off too it be therefore a matter for hearty congratulation that on the whole wage be high to day in the united states than ever before in our history and far high than in any other country the standard of living be also high than ever before every effort of legislator and administrator should be bent to secure the permanency of this condition of thing and its improvement wherever possible not only must our labor be protect by the tariff but it should also be protect so far as it be possible from the presence in this country of any laborer bring over by contract or of those who come freely yet represent a standard of living so depressed that they can undersell our man in the labor market and drag they to a low level i regard it as necessary with this end in view to re enact immediately the law exclude chinese laborer and to strengthen it wherever necessary in order to make its enforcement entirely effective

 the national government should demand the high quality of service from its employee and in return it should be a good employer if possible legislation should be pass in connection with the interstate commerce law which will render effective the effort of different states to do away with the competition of convict contract labor in the open labor market so far as practicable under the condition of government work provision should be make to render the enforcement of the eight hour law easy and certain in all industry carry on directly or indirectly for the united states government woman and child should be protect from excessive hour of labor from night work and from work under unsanitary condition the government should provide in its contract that all work should be do under fair condition and in addition to set a high standard should uphold it by proper inspection extend if necessary to the subcontractor the government should forbid all night work for woman and child as well as excessive overtime for the district of columbia a good factory law should be pass and as a powerful indirect aid to such law provision should be make to turn the inhabited alley the existence of which be a reproach to our capital city into minor street where the inhabitant can live under condition favorable to health and moral

 american wage worker work with their head as well as their hand moreover they take a keen pride in what they be do so that independent of the reward they wish to turn out a perfect job this be the great secret of our success in competition with the labor of foreign country

 the most vital problem with which this country and for that matter the whole civilized world have to deal be the problem which have for one side the betterment of social condition moral and physical in large city and for another side the effort to deal with that tangle of far reach question which we group together when we speak of labor the chief factor in the success of each man wage worker farmer and capitalist alike must ever be the sum total of his own individual quality and ability second only to this come the power of act in combination or association with other very great good have be and will be accomplish by association or union of wage worker when manage with forethought and when they combine insistence upon their own right with law abide respect for the right of other the display of these quality in such body be a duty to the nation no less than to the association themselves finally there must also in many case be action by the government in order to safeguard the right and interest of all under our constitution there be much more scope for such action by the state and the municipality than by the nation but on point such as those touch on above the national government can act

 when all be say and do the rule of brotherhood remain as the indispensable prerequisite to success in the kind of national life for which we strive each man must work for himself and unless he so work no outside help can avail he but each man must remember also that he be indeed his brother&#39;s keeper and that while no man who refuse to walk can be carry with advantage to himself or anyone else yet that each at time stumble or halt that each at time need to have the help hand outstretche to he to be permanently effective aid must always take the form of help a man to help himself and we can all good help ourselves by join together in the work that be of common interest to all

 our present immigration law be unsatisfactory we need every honest and efficient immigrant fit to become an american citizen every immigrant who come here to stay who bring here a strong body a stout heart a good head and a resolute purpose to do his duty well in every way and to bring up his child as law abide and god fear member of the community but there should be a comprehensive law enact with the object of work a threefold improvement over our present system first we should aim to exclude absolutely not only all person who be know to be believer in anarchistic principle or member of anarchistic society but also all person who be of a low moral tendency or of unsavory reputation this mean that we should require a more thorough system of inspection abroad and a more rigid system of examination at our immigration port the former be especially necessary

 the second object of a proper immigration law ought to be to secure by a careful and not merely perfunctory educational test some intelligent capacity to appreciate american institution and act sanely as american citizen this would not keep out all anarchist for many of they belong to the intelligent criminal class but it would do what be also in point that is tend to decrease the sum of ignorance so potent in produce the envy suspicion malignant passion and hatred of order out of which anarchistic sentiment inevitably spring finally all person should be exclude who be below a certain standard of economic fitness to enter our industrial field as competitor with american labor there should be proper proof of personal capacity to earn an american living and enough money to insure a decent start under american condition this would stop the influx of cheap labor and the result competition which give rise to so much of bitterness in american industrial life and it would dry up the spring of the pestilential social condition in our great city where anarchistic organization have their great possibility of growth

 both the educational and economic test in a wise immigration law should be design to protect and elevate the general body politic and social a very close supervision should be exercise over the steamship company which mainly bring over the immigrant and they should be hold to a strict accountability for any infraction of the law

 there be general acquiescence in our present tariff system as a national policy the first requisite to our prosperity be the continuity and stability of this economic policy nothing could be more unwise than to disturb the business interest of the country by any general tariff change at this time doubt apprehension uncertainty be exactly what we most wish to avoid in the interest of our commercial and material well being our experience in the past have show that sweeping revision of the tariff be apt to produce condition closely approach panic in the business world yet it be not only possible but eminently desirable to combine with the stability of our economic system a supplementary system of reciprocal benefit and obligation with other nation such reciprocity be an incident and result of the firm establishment and preservation of our present economic policy it be specially provide for in the present tariff law

 reciprocity must be treat as the handmaiden of protection our first duty be to see that the protection grant by the tariff in every case where it be need be maintain and that reciprocity be seek for so far as it can safely be do without injury to our home industry just how far this be must be determine accord to the individual case remember always that every application of our tariff policy to meet our shift national need must be condition upon the cardinal fact that the duty must never be reduce below the point that will cover the difference between the labor cost here and abroad the well being of the wage worker be a prime consideration of our entire policy of economic legislation

 subject to this proviso of the proper protection necessary to our industrial well being at home the principle of reciprocity must command our hearty support the phenomenal growth of our export trade emphasize the urgency of the need for wide market and for a liberal policy in deal with foreign nation whatever be merely petty and vexatious in the way of trade restriction should be avoid the customer to whom we dispose of our surplus product in the long run directly or indirectly purchase those surplus product by give we something in return their ability to purchase our product should as far as possible be secure by so arrange our tariff as to enable we to take from they those product which we can use without harm to our own industry and labor or the use of which will be of mark benefit to we

 it be most important that we should maintain the high level of our present prosperity we have now reach the point in the development of our interest where we be not only able to supply our own market but to produce a constantly grow surplus for which we must find market abroad to secure these market we can utilize exist duty in any case where they be no long need for the purpose of protection or in any case where the article be not produce here and the duty be no long necessary for revenue as give we something to offer in exchange for what we ask the cordial relation with other nation which be so desirable will naturally be promote by the course thus require by our own interest

 the natural line of development for a policy of reciprocity will be in connection with those of our production which no long require all of the support once need to establish they upon a sound basis and with those other where either because of natural or of economic cause we be beyond the reach of successful competition

 i ask the attention of the senate to the reciprocity treaty lay before it by my predecessor

 the condition of the american merchant marine be such as to call for immediate remedial action by the congress it be discreditable to we as a nation that our merchant marine should be utterly insignificant in comparison to that of other nation which we overtop in other form of business we should not long submit to condition under which only a trifling portion of our great commerce be carry in our own ship to remedy this state of thing would not .merely serve to build up our shipping interest but it would also result in benefit to all who be interested in the permanent establishment of a wide market for american product and would provide an auxiliary force for the navy ship work for their own country just as railroad work for their terminal point shipping line if establish to the principal country with which we have dealing would be of political as well as commercial benefit from every standpoint it be unwise for the united states to continue to rely upon the ship of compete nation for the distribution of our good it should be make advantageous to carry american good in american build ship

 at present american shipping be under certain great disadvantage when put in competition with the shipping of foreign country many of the fast foreign steamship at a speed of fourteen knot or above be subsidize and all our ship sailing vessel and steamer alike cargo carrier of slow speed and mail carrier of high speed have to meet the fact that the original cost of build american ship be great than be the case abroad that the wage pay american officer and seaman be very much high than those pay the officer and seaman of foreign compete country and that the standard of live on our ship be far superior to the standard of live on the ship of our commercial rival

 our government should take such action as will remedy these inequality the american merchant marine should be restore to the ocean

 the act of march 14 1900 intend unequivocally to establish gold as the standard money and to maintain at a parity therewith all form of money medium in use with we have be show to be timely and judicious the price of our government bond in the world&#39;s market when compare with the price of similar obligation issue by other nation be a flattering tribute to our public credit this condition it be evidently desirable to maintain

 in many respect the national banking law furnish sufficient liberty for the proper exercise of the banking function but there seem to be need of well safeguard against the deranging influence of commercial crisis and financial panic moreover the currency of the country should be make responsive to the demand of our domestic trade and commerce

 the collection from duty on import and internal taxis continue to exceed the ordinary expenditure of the government thank mainly to the reduced army expenditure the utmost care should be take not to reduce the revenue so that there will be any possibility of a deficit but after provide against any such contingency mean should be adopt which will bring the revenue more nearly within the limit of our actual need in his report to the congress the secretary of the treasury consider all these question at length and i ask your attention to the report and recommendation

 i call special attention to the need of strict economy in expenditure the fact that our national need forbid we to be niggardly in provide whatever be actually necessary to our well being should make we doubly careful to husband our national resource as each of we husband his private resource by scrupulous avoidance of anything like wasteful or reckless expenditure only by avoidance of spend money on what be needless or unjustifiable can we legitimately keep our income to the point require to meet our need that be genuine

 in 1887 a measure be enact for the regulation of interstate railway commonly know as the interstate commerce act the cardinal provision of that act be that railway rate should be just and reasonable and that all shipper locality and commodity should be accord equal treatment a commission be create and endow with what be suppose to be the necessary power to execute the provision of this act that law be largely an experiment experience have show the wisdom of its purpose but have also show possibly that some of its requirement be wrong certainly that the mean devise for the enforcement of its provision be defective those who complain of the management of the railway allege that establish rate be not maintain that rebate and similar device be habitually resort to that these preference be usually in favor of the large shipper that they drive out of business the small competitor that while many rate be too low many other be excessive and that gross preference be make affect both locality and commodity upon the other hand the railway assert that the law by its very term tend to produce many of these illegal practice by deprive carrier of that right of concerted action which they claim be necessary to establish and maintain non discriminating rate

 the act should be amend the railway be a public servant its rate should be just to and open to all shipper alike the government should see to it that within its jurisdiction this be so and should provide a speedy inexpensive and effective remedy to that end at the same time it must not be forget that our railway be the artery through which the commercial lifeblood of this nation flow nothing could be more foolish than the enactment of legislation which would unnecessarily interfere with the development and operation of these commercial agency the subject be one of great importance and call for the earnest attention of the congress

 the department of agriculture during the past fifteen year have steadily broaden its work on economic line and have accomplish result of real value in upbuilde domestic and foreign trade it have go into new field until it be now in touch with all section of our country and with two of the island group that have lately come under our jurisdiction whose people must look to agriculture as a livelihood it be search the world for grain grass fruit and vegetable specially fit for introduction into locality in the several states and territories where they may add materially to our resource by scientific attention to soil survey and possible new crop to breeding of new variety of plant to experimental shipment to animal industry and applied chemistry very practical aid have be give our farming and stock grow interest the product of the farm have take an unprecedented place in our export trade during the year that have just close

 public opinion throughout the united states have move steadily toward a just appreciation of the value of forest whether plant or of natural growth the great part play by they in the creation and maintenance of the national wealth be now more fully realize than ever before

 wise forest protection do not mean the withdrawal of forest resource whether of wood water or grass from contribute their full share to the welfare of the people but on the contrary give the assurance of large and more certain supply the fundamental idea of forestry be the perpetuation of forest by use forest protection be not an end of itself it be a means to increase and sustain the resource of our country and the industry which depend upon they the preservation of our forest be an imperative business necessity we have come to see clearly that whatever destroy the forest except to make way for agriculture threaten our well be
