to the senate and house of representatives
 i call your attention to certain measure as to which i think there should be action by the congress before the close of the present session there be ample time for their consideration as regard most if not all of the matter bill have be introduce into one or the other of the two houses and it be not too much to hope that action will be take one way or the other on these bill at the present session in my message at the opening of the present session and indeed in various message to previous congresses i have repeatedly suggest action on most of these measure
 child labor should be prohibit throughout the nation at least a model child labor bill should be pass for the district of columbia it be unfortunate that in the one place solely dependent upon congress for its legislation there should be no law whatever to protect child by forbid or regulate their labor
 i renew my recommendation for the immediate reenactment of an employers&#39 liability law draw to conform to the recent decision of the supreme court within the limit indicate by the court the law should be make through and comprehensive and the protection it afford should embrace every class of employee to which the power of the congress can extend
 in addition to a liability law protect the employee of common carrier the government should show its good faith by enact a further law give compensation to its own employee for injury or death incur in its service it be a reproach to we as a nation that in both federal and state legislation we have afford less protection to public and private employee than any other industrial country of the world
 i also urge that action be take along the line of the recommendation i have already make concern injunction in labor dispute no temporary restraining order should be issue by any court without notice and the petition for a permanent injunction upon which such temporary restraining order have be issue should be hear by the court issue the same within a reasonable time say not to exceed a week or thereabout from the date when the order be issue it be worth consider whether it would not give great popular confidence in the impartiality of sentence for contempt if it be require that the issue should be decide by another judge than the one issue the injunction except where the contempt be commit in the presence of the court or in other case of urgency
 i again call attention to the urgent need of amend the interstate commerce law and especially the anti trust law along the line indicate in my last message the interstate commerce law should be amend so as to give railroad the right to make traffic agreement subject to these agreement be approve by the interstate commerce commission and publish in all of their detail the commission should also be give the power to make public and to pass upon the issuance of all security hereafter issue by railroad do an interstate commerce business
 a law should be pass provide in effect that when a federal court determine to place a common carrier or other public utility concern under the control of a receivership the attorney general should have the right to nominate at least one of the receiver or else in some other way the interest of the stockholder should be consult so that the management may not be wholly redelivere to the man or man the failure of whose policy may have necessitate the creation of the receivership receivership should be use not to operate road but as speedily as possible to pay their debt and return they to the proper owner
 in addition to the reason i have already urge on your attention it have now become important that there should be an amendment of the anti trust law because of the uncertainty as to how this law affect combination among labor man and farmer if the combination have any tendency to restrict interstate commerce all of these combination if and while exist for and engage in the promotion of innocent and proper purpose should be recognize as legal as i have repeatedly point out this antitrust law be a most unwisely draw statute it be perhaps inevitable that in feeling after the right remedy the first attempt to provide such should be crude and it be absolutely imperative that some legislation should be pass to control in the interest of the public the business use of the enormous aggregation of corporate wealth that be so mark a feature of the modern industrial world but the present anti trust law in its construction and working have exemplify only too well the kind of legislation which under the guise of be thoroughgoe be draw up in such sweeping form as to become either ineffective or else mischievous
 in the modern industrial world combination be absolutely necessary they be necessary among business man they be necessary among labor man they be become more and more necessary among farmer some of these combination be among the most powerful of all instrument for wrongdoing other offer the only effective way of meet actual business need it be mischievous and unwholesome to keep upon the statute book unmodified a law like the anti trust law which while in practice only partially effective against vicious combination have nevertheless in theory be construe so as sweepingly to prohibit every combination for the transaction of modern business some real good have result from this law but the time have come when it be imperative to modify it such modification be urgently need for the sake of the business man of the country for the sake of the wage worker and for the sake of the farmer the congress can not afford to leave it on the statute book in its present shape
 it have now become uncertain how far this law may involve all labor organization and farmers&#39 organization as well as all business organization in conflict with the law or if we secure literal compliance with the law how far it may result in the destruction of the organization necessary for the transaction of modern business as well as of all labor organization and farmers&#39 organization completely check the wise movement for secure business cooperation among farmer and put back half a century the progress of the movement for the betterment of labor a bill have be present in the congress to remedy this situation some such measure as this bill be need in the interest of all engage in the industry which be essential to the country&#39; well being i do not pretend to say the exact shape that the bill should take and the suggestion i have to offer be tentative and my view would apply equally to any other measure which would achieve the desire end bear this in mind i would suggest merely tentatively the follow change in the law
 the substantive part of the anti trust law should remain as at present that is every contract in restraint of trade or commerce among the several states or with foreign nation should continue to be declare illegal provide however that some proper governmental authority such as the commissioner of corporations act under the secretary of commerce and labor be allow to pass on any such contract probably the good method of provide for this would be to enact that any contract subject to the prohibition contain in the antitrust law into which it be desire to enter might be file with the bureau of corporations or other appropriate executive body this would provide publicity within say sixty day of the filing which period could be extend by order of the department whenever for any reason it do not give the department sufficient time for a thorough examination the executive department have power might forbid the contract which would then become subject to the provision of the anti trust law if at all in restraint of trade
 if no such prohibition be issue the contract would then only be liable to attack on the ground that it constitute an unreasonable restraint of trade whenever the period of filing have pass without any such prohibition the contract or combination could be disapprove or forbid only after notice and hear with a reasonable provision for summary review on appeal by the court labor organization farmers&#39 organization and other organization not organize for purpose of profit should be allow to register under the law by give the location of the head office the charter and by law and the name and address of their principal officer in the interest of all these organization business labor and farmers&#39 organization alike the present provision permit the recovery of threefold damage should be abolish and as a substitute therefor the right of recovery allow for should be only the damage sustain by the plaintiff and the cost of suit include a reasonable attorney&#39;s fee
 the law should not affect pende suit a short statute of limitation should be provide so far as the past be concern not to exceed a year moreover and even more in the interest of labor than of business combination all such suit bring for cause of action heretofore occur should be bring only if the contract or combination complain of be unfair or unreasonable it may be well to remember that all of the suit hitherto bring by the government under the antitrust law have be in case where the combination or contract be in fact unfair unreasonable and against the public interest
 it be important that we should encourage trade agreement between employer and employee where they be just and fair a strike be a clumsy weapon for right wrong do to labor and we should extend so far as possible the process of conciliation and arbitration as a substitute for strike moreover violence disorder and coercion when commit in connection with strike should be as promptly and sternly repress as when commit in any other connection but strike themselves be and should be recognize to be entirely legal combination of workingman have a peculiar reason for their existence the very wealthy individual employer and still more the very wealthy corporation stand at an enormous advantage when compare to the individual workingman and while there be many case where it may not be necessary for laborer to form a union in many other case it be indispensable for otherwise the thousand of small unit the thousand of individual workingmen will be leave helpless in their dealing with the one big unit the big individual or corporate employer
 twenty two year ago by the act of june 29 1886 trade union be recognize by law and the right of labor people to combine for all lawful purpose be formally recognize this right include combination for mutual protection and benefit the regulation of wage hour and condition of labor and the protection of the individual right of the workman in the prosecution of their trade or trade and in the act of june 1 1898 strike be recognize as legal in the same provision that forbid participation in or instigation of force or violence against person or property or the attempt to prevent other from work by violence threat or intimidation the business man must be protect in person and property and so must the farmer and the wageworker and as regard all alike the right of peaceful combination for all lawful purpose should be explicitly recognize
 the right of employer to combine and contract with one another and with their employee should be explicitly recognize and so should the right of the employee to combine and to contract with one another and with the employer and to seek peaceably to persuade other to accept their view and to strike for the purpose of peaceably obtain from employer satisfactory term for their labor nothing should be do to legalize either a blacklist or a boycott that would be illegal at common law this be the type of boycott define and condemn by the anthracite strike commission
 the question of financial legislation be now receive such attention in both houses that we have a right to expect action before the close of the session it be urgently necessary that there should be such action moreover action should be take to establish postal saving bank these postal saving bank be imperatively need for the benefit of the wageworker and man of small mean and will be a valuable adjunct to our whole financial system
 the time have come when we should prepare for a revision of the tariff this should be and indeed must be precede by careful investigation it be peculiarly the province of the congress and not of the president and indeed peculiarly the province of the house of representatives to originate a tariff bill and to determine upon its term and this i fully realize yet it seem to i that before the close of this session provision should be make for collect full material which will enable the congress elect next fall to act immediately after it come into existence this would necessitate some action by the congress at its present session perhaps in the shape of direct the proper committee to gather the necessary information both through the committee itself and through government agent who should report to the committee and should lay before it the fact which would permit it to act with prompt and intelligent fairness these government agent if it be not deem wise to appoint individual from outside the public service might with advantage be member of the executive departments designate by the president on his own motion or on the request of the committee to act with it
 i be of the opinion however that one change in the tariff could with advantage be make forthwith our forest need every protection and one method of protect they would be to put upon the free list wood pulp with a corresponding reduction upon paper make from wood pulp when they come from any country that do not put an export duty upon they
 ample provision should be make for a permanent waterways commission with whatever power be require to make it effective the reasonable expectation of the people will not be meet unless the congress provide at this session for the beginning and prosecution of the actual work or waterway improvement and control the congress should recognize in full fashion the fact that the subject of the conservation of our natural resource with which this commission deal be literally vital for the future of the nation
 numerous bill grant water power right on navigable stream have be introduce none of they give the government the right to make a reasonable charge for the valuable privilege so grant in spite of the fact that these water power privilege be equivalent to many thousand of acre of the good coal land for their production of power nor be any definite time limit set as should always be do in such case i shall be oblige hereafter in accordance with the policy state in a recent message to veto any water power bill which do not provide for a time limit and for the right of the president or of the secretary concern to fix and collect such a charge as he may find to be just and reasonable in each case

to the senate and house of representatives finance the financial standing of the nation at the present time be excellent and the financial management of the nation 's interest by the government during the last seven year have show the most satisfactory result but our currency system be imperfect and it be earnestly to be hope that the currency commission will be able to propose a thoroughly good system which will do away with the exist defect during the period from july 1 1901 to september 30 1908 there be an increase in the amount of money in circulation of $ 902,991,399 the increase in the per capita during this period be $ 7.06 within this time there be several occasion when it be necessary for the treasury department to come to the relief of the money market by purchase or redemption of united states bond by increase deposit in national bank by stimulate additional issue of national bank note and by facilitate importation from abroad of gold our imperfect currency system have make these proceeding necessary and they be effective until the monetary disturbance in the fall of 1907 immensely increase the difficulty of ordinary method of relief by the middle of november the available work balance in the treasury have be reduce to approximately $ 5,000,000 clearing house association throughout the country have be oblige to resort to the expedient of issue clearing house certificate to be use as money in this emergency it be determined to invite subscription for $ 50,000,000 panama canal bond and $ 100,000,000 three per cent certificate of indebtedness authorize by the act of june 13 1898 it be propose to re deposit in the national bank the proceed of these issue and to permit their use as a basis for additional circulate note of national bank the moral effect of this procedure be so great that it be necessary to issue only $ 24,631,980 of the panama canal bond and $ 15,436,500 of the certificate of indebtedness during the period from july 1 1901 to september 30 1908 the balance between the net ordinary receipt and the net ordinary expense of the government show a surplus in the four year 1902 1903 1906 and 1907 and a deficit in the year 1904 1905 1908 and a fractional part of the fiscal year 1909 the net result be a surplus of $ 99,283,413.54 the financial operation of the government during this period base upon these difference between receipt and expenditure result in a net reduction of the interest bear debt of the united states from $ 987,141,040 to $ 897,253,990 notwithstanding that there have be two sale of panama canal bond amount in the aggregate to $ 54,631,980 and an issue of three per cent certificate of indebtedness under the act of june 13 1998 amount to $ 15,436,500 refund operation of the treasury department under the act of march 14 1900 result in the conversion into two per cent consol of 1930 of $ 200,309,400 bond bear high rate of interest a decrease of $ 8,687,956 in the annual interest charge result from these operation in short during the seven year and three month there have be a net surplus of nearly one hundred million of receipt over expenditure a reduction of the interest bear debt by ninety million in spite of the extraordinary expense of the panama canal and a saving of nearly nine million on the annual interest charge this be an exceedingly satisfactory showing especially in view of the fact that during this period the nation have never hesitate to undertake any expenditure that it regard as necessary there have be no new taxis and no increase of taxis on the contrary some taxis have be take off there have be a reduction of taxation corporations .as regard the great corporation engage in interstate business and especially the railroad i can only repeat what i have already again and again say in my message to the congress i believe that under the interstate clause of the constitution the united states have complete and paramount right to control all agency of interstate commerce and i believe that the national government alone can exercise this right with wisdom and effectiveness so as both to secure justice from and to do justice to the great corporation which be the most important factor in modern business i believe that it be bad than folly to attempt to prohibit all combination as be do by the sherman anti trust law because such a law can be enforce only imperfectly and unequally and its enforcement work almost as much hardship as good i strongly advocate that instead of an unwise effort to prohibit all combination there shall be substitute a law which shall expressly permit combination which be in the interest of the public but shall at the same time give to some agency of the national government full power of control and supervision over they one of the chief feature of this control should be secure entire publicity in all matter which the public have a right to know and furthermore the power not by judicial but by executive action to prevent or put a stop to every form of improper favoritism or other wrongdoing the railway of the country should be put completely under the interstate commerce commission and remove from the domain of the anti trust law the power of the commission should be make thoroughgoing so that it could exercise complete supervision and control over the issue of security as well as over the raising and lowering of rate as regard rate at least this power should be summary the power to investigate the financial operation and account of the railway have be one of the most valuable feature in recent legislation power to make combination and traffic agreement should be explicitly confer upon the railroad the permission of the commission be first gain and the combination or agreement be publish in all its detail in the interest of the public the representative of the public should have complete power to see that the railroad do their duty by the public and as a matter of course this power should also be exercise so as to see that no injustice be do to the railroad the shareholder the employee and the shipper all have interest that must be guard it be to the interest of all of they that no swindle stock speculation should be allow and that there should be no improper issuance of security the guiding intelligence necessary for the successful building and successful management of railroad should receive ample remuneration but no man should be allow to make money in connection with railroad out of fraudulent over capitalization and kindre stock gambling performance there must be no defrauding of investor oppression of the farmer and business man who ship freight or callous disregard of the right and need of the employee in addition to this the interest of the shareholder of the employee and of the shipper should all be guard as against one another to give any one of they undue and improper consideration be to do injustice to the other rate must be make as low as be compatible with give proper return to all the employee of the railroad from the high to the low and proper return to the shareholder but they must not for instance be reduce function which properly belong to the legislative body be all wrong and in the end work mischief the people should not be permit to pardon evil and slipshod legislation on the theory that the court will set it right they should be teach that the right way to get rid of a bad law be to have the legislature repeal it and not to have the court by ingenious hair splitting nullify it a law may be unwise and improper but it should not for these reason be declare unconstitutional by a strained interpretation for the result of such action be to take away from the people at large their sense of responsibility and ultimately to destroy their capacity for orderly self restraint and self government under such a popular government as ours round on the theory that in the long run the will of the people be supreme the ultimate safety of the nation can only rest in training and guide the people so that what they will shall be right and not in devising mean to defeat their will by the the philippines real progress toward self government be be make in the philippine islands the gathering of a philippine legislative body and philippine assembly mark a process absolutely new in asia japan it open an entirely new departure when compare with anything which have happen among asiatic power which be their own master hitherto this philippine legislature have act with moderation and self restraint and have seem in practical fashion to realize the eternal truth that there must always be government and that the only way in which any body of individual can escape the necessity of be govern by outsider be to show that they be able to restrain themselves to keep down wrongdoing and disorder the filipino people through their official be therefore make real step in the direction of self government i hope and believe that these step mark the beginning of a course which will continue till the filipinos become fit to decide for themselves whether they desire to be an independent nation but it be well for they and well also for those americans who during the past decade have do so much damage to the filipinos by agitation for an immediate independence for which they be totally their good and not for our aggrandizement at the present time as during the past ten year the inexorable logic of fact show that this government must be supply by we and not by they we must be wise govern they so that gradually they may if they be able learn to govern themselves under the present system of just law and sympathetic administration we have every reason to believe that they be gradually acquire the character which lie at the basis of self government and for which if it be lack no system of law no paper constitution will in any wise serve as a substitute our people in the philippines have achieve what may legitimately be call a marvelous success in give to they a government which mark on the part of those in authority both the necessary understanding of the people and the necessary purpose to serve they disinterestedly and in good faith i trust that within a generation the time will arrive when the philippines can decide for themselves whether it be well for they to become independent or to continue under the protection of a strong and disinterested power able to guarantee to the island order at home and protection from foreign invasion but no one can prophesy the exact date when it will be wise to consider independence as a fixed and definite policy it would be bad than folly to try to set down such a date in advance for it must depend upon the way in to the senate and house of representatives
 i have convene congress in this extra session in order to enable it to give immediate consideration to the revision of the dingley tariff act condition affect production manufacture and business generally have so change in the last twelve year as to require a readjustment and revision of the import duty impose by that act more than this the present tariff act with the other source of government revenue do not furnish income enough to pay the authorized expenditure by july 1 next the excess of expense over receipt for the current fiscal year will equal $ 100,000,000
 the successful party in the late lection be pledge to a revision of the tariff the country and the business community especially expect it the prospect of a change in the rate of import duty always cause a suspension or halt in business because of the uncertainty as to the change to be make and their effect it be therefore of the high importance that the new bill should be agree upon and pass with as much speed as possible consistent with its due and thorough consideration for these reason i have deem the present to be an extraordinary occasion within the meaning of the constitution justify and require the calling of an extra session in my inaugural address i state in a summary way the principle upon which in my judgment the revision of the tariff should proceed and indicate at least one new source of revenue that might be properly resort to in order to avoid a future deficit it be not necessary for i to repeat what i then say
 i venture to suggest that the vital business interest of the country require that the attention of the congress in this session be chiefly devoted to the consideration of the new tariff bill and that the less time give to other subject of legislation in this session the well for the country
to the senate and house of representatives
 it be the constitutional duty of the president from time to time to recommend to the consideration of congress such measure as he shall judge necessary and expedient in my inaugural address immediately precede this present extraordinary session of congress i invite attention to the necessity for a revision of the tariff at this session and state the principle upon which i think the revision should be effect i refer to the then rapidly increase deficit and point out the obligation on the part of the framer of the tariff bill to arrange the duty so as to secure an adequate income and suggest that if it be not possible to do so by import duty new kind of taxation must be adopt and among they i recommend a graduate inheritance tax as correct in principle and as certain and easy of collection the house of representatives have adopt the suggestion and have provide in the bill it pass for the collection of such a tax in the senate the action of its finance committee and the course of the debate indicate that it may not agree to this provision and it be now propose to make up the deficit by the imposition of a general income tax in form and substance of almost exactly the same character as that which in the case of pollock v. farmers&#39 loan and trust company 157 u. s. 429 be hold by the supreme court to be a direct tax and therefore not within the power of the federal government to impose unless apportion among the several states accord to population this new proposal which i do not discuss in my inaugural addressor in my message at the opening of the present session make it appropriate for i to submit to the congress certain additional recommendation
 the decision of the supreme court in the income tax case deprive the national government of a power which by reason of previous decision of the court it be generally suppose that government have it be undoubtedly a power the national government ought to have it might be indispensable to the nation&#39;s life in great crisis although i have not consider a constitutional amendment as necessary to the exercise of certain phase of this power a mature consideration have satisfy i that an amendment be the only proper course for its establishment to its full extent i therefore recommend to the congress that both house by a two third vote shall propose an amendment to the constitution confer the power to levy an income tax upon the national government without apportionment among the states in proportion to population
 this course be much to be prefer to the one propose of reenact a law once judicially declare to be unconstitutional for the congress to assume that the court will reverse itself and to enact legislation on such an assumption will not strengthen popular confidence in the stability of judicial construction of the constitution it be much wise policy to accept the decision and remedy the defect by amendment in due and regular course
 again it be clear that by the enactment of the propose law the congress will not be bring money into the treasury to meet the present deficiency but by put on the statute book a law already there and never repeal will simply be suggest to the executive officer of the government their possible duty to invoke litigation if the court should maintain its former view no tax would be collect at all if it should ultimately reverse itself still no taxis would have be collect until after protract delay
 it be say the difficulty and delay in secure the approval of three fourth of the states will destroy all chance of adopt the amendment of course no one can speak with certainty upon this point but i have become convinced that a great majority of the people of this country be in favor of vest the national government with power to levy an income tax and that they will secure the adoption of the amendment in the states if propose to they
 second the decision in the pollock case leave power in the national government to levy an excise tax which accomplish the same purpose as a corporation income tax and be free from certain objection urge to the propose income tax measure
 i therefore recommend an amendment to the tariff bill impose upon all corporation and joint stock company for profit except national bank otherwise tax saving bank and building and loan association an excise tax measure by 2 per cent on the net income of such corporation this be an excise tax upon the privilege of do business as an artificial entity and of freedom from a general partnership liability enjoy by those who own the stock
 i be inform that a 2 per cent tax of this character would bring into the treasury of the united states not less than $ 25,000,000
 the decision of the supreme court in the case of spreckels sugar refining company against mcclain 192 u. s. 397 seem clearly to establish the principle that such a tax as this be an excise tax upon privilege and not a direct tax on property and be within the federal power without apportionment accord to population the tax on net income be preferable to one proportionate to a percentage of the gross receipt because it be a tax upon success and not failure it impose a burden at the source of the income at a time when the corporation be well able to pay and when collection be easy
 another merit of this tax be the federal supervision which must be exercise in order to make the law effective over the annual account and business transaction of all corporation while the faculty of assume a corporate form have be of the utmost utility in the business world it be also true that substantially all of the abuse and all of the evil which have arouse the public to the necessity of reform be make possible by the use of this very faculty if now by a perfectly legitimate and effective system of taxation we be incidentally able to possess the government and the stockholder and the public of the knowledge of the real business transaction and the gain and profit of every corporation in the country we have make along step toward that supervisory control of corporation which may prevent a further abuse of power
 i recommend then first the adoption of a joint resolution by two third of both house propose to the states an amendment to the constitution grant to the federal government the right to levy and collect an income tax without apportionment among the states accord to population and second the enactment as part of the pende revenue measure either as a substitute for or in addition to the inheritance tax of an excise tax upon all corporation measure by 2 per cent of their net income

my fellow citizens as long ago as august 1906 in the congressional campaign in maine i venture to announce that i be a tariff revisionist and think that the time have come for a readjustment of the schedule i point out that it have be ten year prior to that time that the dingley bill have be pass that great change have take place in the condition surround the production of the farm the factory and the mine and that under the theory of protection in that time the rate impose in the dingley bill in many instance might have become excessive that is might have be great than the difference between the cost of production abroad and the cost of production at home with a sufficient allowance for a reasonable rate of profit to the american producer i say that the party be divide on the issue but that in my judgment the opinion of the party be crystallize and would probably result in the near future in an effort to make such revision i point out the difficulty that there always be in a revision of the tariff due to the threaten disturbance of industry to be affect and the suspension of business in a way which make it unwise to have too many revision in the summer of 1907 my position on the tariff be challenge and i then enter into a somewhat full discussion of the matter it be contend by the so call standpatter that rate beyond the necessary measure of protection be not objectionable because behind the tariff wall competition always reduce the price and thus save the consumer but i point out in that speech what seem to i as true to day as it then be that the danger of excessive rate be in the temptation they create to form monopoly in the protect article and thus to take advantage of the excessive rate by increase the price and therefore and in order to avoid such a danger it be wise at regular interval to examine the question of what the effect of the rate have be upon the industry in this country and whether the condition with respect to the cost of production here have so change as to warrant a reduction in the tariff and to make a low rate truly protective of the industry it will be observe that the object of the revision under such a statement be not to destroy protect industry in this country but it be to continue to protect they where low rate offer a sufficient protection to prevent injury by foreign competition that be the object of the case constitute the great need in our american institution i do not doubt for one moment that much of the lawless violence and cruelty exhibit in lynching be directly due to the uncertainty and barbarous the procedure in the federal court should furnish an example for the state court i presume it be impossible without an amendment to the constitution to unite under one form of action the proceeding at common law and proceeding in equity in the federal court but it be certainly not impossible by a statute to simplify and make short and direct the procedure both at law and in equity in those court it be not impossible to cut down still more than it be cut down the jurisdiction of the supreme court so as to confine it almost wholly to statutory and constitutional question under the present statute the equity and admiralty procedure in the federal court be under the control of the supreme court but in the pressure of business to which that court be subject it be impossible to hope that a radical and proper reform of the federal equity procedure can be bring about i therefore recommend legislation provide for the appointment by the president of a commission with authority to examine the law and equity procedure of the federal court of first instance the law of appeal from those court to the court of appeal and to the supreme court and the cost impose in such procedure sanitary condition post office department second class mail matter the deficit every year in the post office department be largely cause by the low rate of postage of 1 cent a pound charge on second class mail matter which include not only newspaper but magazine and miscellaneous periodical the actual loss grow out of the transmission of this second class mail matter at 1 cent a pound amount to about $ 63,000,000 a year the average cost of the transportation of this matter be more than 9 cent a pound it appear that the average distance over which newspaper be deliver to their customer be 291 mile while the average haul of magazine be 1,049 and of miscellaneous periodical 1,128 mile thus the average haul of the magazine be three and one half time and that of the miscellaneous periodical nearly four time the haul of the daily newspaper yet all of they pay the same postage rate of 1 cent a pound the statistic of 1907 show that second class mail matter constitute 63.91 per cent of the weight of all the mail and yield only 5.19 per cent of the revenue the figure give be startling and show the payment by the government of an enormous subsidy to the newspaper magazine and periodical and congress may well consider whether radical step should not be take to reduce the deficit in the post office department cause by this discrepancy between the actual cost of transportation and the compensation exact therefor a great saving might be make amount to much more than half of the loss by impose upon magazine and periodical a high rate of postage they be much heavy than newspaper and contain a much high proportion of advertising to read matter and the average distance of their transportation be three and a half time as great the total deficit for the last fiscal year in the post in which the loss be $ 28,000,000 these loss be in part offset by the profit of the letter postage and other source of income it would seem wise to reduce the loss upon second class mail matter at least to the extent of prevent a deficit in the total operation of the post office i commend the whole subject to congress not unmindful of the spread of intelligence which a low charge for carry newspaper and periodical assist i very much doubt however the wisdom of a policy which constitute so large a subsidy and require additional taxation to meet it postal savings bank the second subject
