a special message on this general subject i urge the continuance of the appropriation of $ 100,000 request for the fiscal year 1912.civil service retirement it be impossible to proceed far in such an investigation without perceive the need of a suitable mean of eliminate from the service the superannuate this can be do in one of two way either by straight civil pension or by some form of contributory plan careful study of experiment make by foreign government show that three serious objection to the civil pension payable out of the public treasury may be bring against it by the taxpayer the administrative officer and the civil employee respectively a civil pension be bind to become an enormous continuous and increase tax on the public exchequer it be demoralize to the service since it make difficult the dismissal of incompetent employee after they have partly earn their pension and it be disadvantageous to the main body of employee themselves since it be always take into account in fix salary and only the few who survive and remain in the service until pensionable age receive the value of their defer pay for this reason after a half century of experience under a most liberal pension system the civil servant of england succeed about a year ago in have the system so modify as to make it virtually a contributory plan with provision for refund of their theoretical contribution the experience of england and other country show that neither can a contributory plan be successful human nature be what it be which do not make provision for the return of contribution with interest in case of death or resignation before pensionable age follow to its logical conclusion this mean that the simple and most independent solution of the problem for both employee and the government be a compulsory saving arrangement the employee to set aside from his salary a sum sufficient with the help of a liberal rate of interest from the government to purchase an adequate annuity for he on retirement this accumulation to be inalienably his and claimable if he leave the service before reach the retirement age or by his heir in case of his death this be the principle upon which the gillett bill now pende be draw the gillett bill however go far and provide that the government shall contribute to the pension fund of those employee who be now so advanced in age that their personal contribution will not be sufficient to create their annuity before reach the retirement age in my judgment this provision should be amend so that the annuity of those employee shall be pay out of the salary appropriate for the position vacate by retirement and that the difference between the annuity thus grant and the salary may be use for the employment of efficient clerk at the low grade if the bill can be thus amend i recommend its passage as it will initiate a valuable system and ultimately result in a great saving in the public expenditure interstate commerce commission there have not be time to test the benefit and utility of the amendment to the interstate commerce law contain in the act approve june 18 1910 the law as enact do not contain all the feature which i recommend it do not specifically denounce as unlawful the purchase by one of two parallel and compete road of the stock of the other nor do it subject to the restrain influence of the interstate commerce commission the power of corporation engage in operate interstate railroad to issue new stock and bond nor do it authorize the making of temporary agreement between railroad limit to thirty day fix the same rate for traffic between the same place i do not press the consideration of any of these object upon congress at this session the object of the first provision be probably generally cover by the antitrust law the second provision be in the act refer to the consideration of a commission to be appoint by the executive and to report upon the matter to congress that commission have be appoint and be engage in the investigation and consideration of the question submit under the law it consist of president arthur t. hadley of yale university as chairman frederick strauss frederick n. judson walter l. fisher and prof. b. h. meyer with william e. s. griswold as secretary the third proposal lead to so much misconstruction of its object as be that of weaken the effectiveness of the antitrust law that i be not disposed to press it for further consideration it be intend to permit railroad company to avoid useless rate cutting by a mere temporary acquiescence in the same rate for the same service over compete railroad with no obligation whatever to maintain those rate for any time safety appliance and provision the protection of railroad employee from personal injury be a subject of the high importance and demand continue attention there have be two measure pende in congress one for the supervision of boiler and the other for the enlargement of dangerous clearance certainly some measure ought to be adopt look to a prevention of accident from these cause it seem to i that with respect to boiler a bill might well be draw require and enforce by penalty a proper system of inspection by the railway company themselves which would accomplish our purpose the entire removal of outside clearance would be attend by such enormous expense that some other remedy must be adopt by act of may 6 1910 the interstate commerce commission be authorize and direct to investigate accident to report their cause and its recommendation i suggest that the commission be request to make a special report as to injury from outside clearance and the good method of reduce they valuation of railroads the interstate commerce commission have recommend appropriation for the purpose of enable it to enter upon a valuation of all railroad this have always be within the jurisdiction of the commission but the requisite fund have be want statistic of the value of each railroad would be valuable for many purpose especially if we ultimately enact any limitation upon the power of the interstate railroad to issue stock and bond as i hope we may i think therefore that in order to permit a correct understanding of the fact it would be wise to make a reasonable appropriation to enable the interstate commerce commission to proceed with due dispatch to the valuation of all railroad i have no doubt that railroad company themselves can and will greatly facilitate this valuation and make it much less costly in time and money than have be suppose fraudulent bill of lading forged and fraudulent hill of lading purport to be issue against cotton some month since result in loss of several million of dollar to american and foreign banking and cotton interest foreign banker then notify american banker that after october 31 1910 they would not accept bill of exchange draw against bill of lading for cotton issue by american railroad company unless american banker would guarantee the integrity of the bill of lading the american banker rightly maintain that they be not justify in give such guarantee and that if they do so the united states would be the only country in the world whose bill be so discredited and whose foreign trade be carry on under such guaranty the foreign banker extend the time at which these guaranty be demand until december 31 1910 rely upon we for protection in the meantime as the money which they furnish to move our cotton crop be of great value to this country for the protection of our own people and the preservation of our credit in foreign trade i urge upon congress the immediate enactment of a law under which one who in good faith advance money or credit upon a bill of lading issue by a common carrier upon an interstate or foreign shipment can hold the carrier liable for the value of the good describe in the bill at the valuation specify in the bill at least to the extent of the advance make in reliance upon it such liability exist under the law of many of the states i see no objection to permit two class of bill of lading to be issue i those under which a carrier shall be absolutely liable as above suggest and 2 those with respect to which the carrier shall assume no liability except for the good actually deliver to the agent issue the bill the carrier might be permit to make a small separate specific charge in addition to the rate of transportation for such guarantee bill as an insurance premium against loss from the add risk thus remove the principal objection which i understand be make by the railroad company to the imposition of the liability suggest viz that the ordinary transportation rate would not compensate they for the liability assume by the absolute guaranty of the accuracy of the bill of lading i far recommend that a punishment of fine and imprisonment be impose upon railroad agent and shipper for fraud or misrepresentation in connection with the issue of bill of lading issue upon interstate and foreign shipment general conclusion as to interstate commerce and antitrust law except as above i do not recommend any amendment to the interstate commerce law as it stand i do not now recommend any amendment to the anti trust law in other word it seem to i that the exist legislation with reference to the regulation of corporation and the restraint of their business have reach a point where we can stop for a while and witness the effect of the vigorous execution of the law on the statute book in restrain the abuse which certainly do exist and which rouse the public to demand reform if this test develop a need for further legislation well and good but until then let we execute what we have due to the reform movement of the present decade there have undoubtedly be a great improvement in business method and standard the great body of business man of this country those who be responsible for its commercial development now have an earnest desire to obey the law and to square their conduct of business to its requirement and limitation these will doubtless be make clear by the decision of the supreme court in case pende before it it be in the interest of all the people of the country that for the time be the activity of government in addition to enforce earnestly and impartially the exist law should be direct to economy of administration to the enlargement of opportunity for foreign trade to the conservation and improvement of our agricultural land and our other natural resource to the building up of home industry and to the strengthening of confidence of capital in domestic investment
to the senate and house of representatives
 in my annual message of december 6 1910 i state that the policy of broad and close trade relation with the dominion of canada which be initiate in the adjustment of the maximum and minimum provision of the tariff act of august 5 1909 have prove mutually beneficial and that it justify further effort for the readjustment of the commercial relation of the two country i also inform you that by my direction the secretary of state have dispatch two representative of the department of state as special commissioner to ottawa to confer with representative of the dominion government that they be authorize to take step to formulate a reciprocal trade agreement and that the ottawa conference thus begin have be adjourn to be resume in washington
 on the 7th of the present month two cabinet minister come to washington as representative of the dominion government and the conference be continue between they and the secretary of state the result of the negotiation be that on the 21st instant a reciprocal trade agreement be reach the text of which be herewith transmit with accompany correspondence and other datum
 one by one the controversy result from the uncertainty which attend the partition of british territory on the american continent at the close of the revolution and which be inevitable under the then condition have be eliminate some by arbitration and some by direct negotiation the merit of these dispute many of they extend through a century need not now be review they relate to the settlement of boundary the definition of right of navigation the interpretation of treaty and many other subject
 through the friendly sentiment the energetic effort and the broadly patriotic view of successive administration and especially of that of my immediate predecessor all these question have be settle the most acute relate to the atlantic fishery and this longstanding controversy after amicable negotiation be refer to the hague tribunal the judgment of that august international court have be accept by the people of both country and a satisfactory agreement in pursuance of the judgment have end completely the controversy an equitable arrangement have recently be reach between our interstate commerce commission and the similar body in canada in regard to through rate on the transportation line between the two country
 the path having be thus open for the improvement of commercial relation a reciprocal trade agreement be the logical sequence of all that have be accomplish in dispose of matter of a diplomatic and controversial character the identity of interest of two people link together by race language political institution and geographical proximity offer the foundation the contribution to the industrial advancement of our own country by the migration across the boundary of the thrifty and industrious canadians of english scotch and french origin be now repay by the movement of large number of our own sturdy farmer to the northwest of canada thus give their labor their mean and their experience to the development of that section with its agricultural possibility
 the guide motive in seek adjustment of trade relation between two country so situated geographically should be to give play to productive force as far as practicable regardless of political boundary while equivalency should be seek in an arrangement of this character an exact balance of financial gain be neither imperative nor attainable no yardstick can measure the benefit to the two people of this free commercial intercourse and no trade agreement should be judge wholly by custom house statistic
 we have reach a stage in our own development that call for a statesmanlike and broad view of our future economic status and its requirement we have draw upon our natural resource in such a way as to invite attention to their necessary limit this have properly arouse effort to conserve they to avoid their waste and to restrict their use to our necessity we have so increase in population and in our consumption of food product and the other necessity of life hitherto supply largely from our own country that unless we materially increase our production we can see before we a change in our economic position from that of a country sell to the world food and natural product of the farm and forest to one consume and import they exclude cotton which be exceptional a radical change be already show in our export in the fall off in the amount of our agricultural product sell abroad and a corresponding mark increase in our manufacture export a farsighte policy require that if we can enlarge our supply of natural resource and especially of food product and the necessity of life without substantial injury to any of our produce and manufacturing class we should take step to do so now we have on the north of we a country contiguous to ours for three thousand mile with natural resource of the same character as ours which have not be draw upon as ours have be and in the development of which the condition as to wage and character of the wage earner and transportation to market differ but little from those prevail with we the difference be not great than it be between different state of our own country or between different province of the dominion of canada ought we not then to arrange a commercial agreement with canada if we can by which we shall have direct access to her great supply of natural product without an obstructing or prohibitory tariff this be not a violation of the protective principle as that have be authoritatively announce by those who uphold it because that principle do not call for a tariff between this country and one whose condition as to production population and wage be so like ours and when our common boundary line of three thousand mile in itself must make a radical distinction between our commercial treatment of canada and of any other country
 the dominion have greatly prosper it have an active aggressive and intelligent people they be come to the parting of the way they must soon decide whether they be to regard themselves as isolate permanently from our market by a perpetual wall or whether we be to be commercial friend if we give they reason to take the former view can we complain if they adopt method deny access to certain of their natural resource except upon condition quite unfavorable to we a notable instance of such a possibility may be see in the condition surround the supply of pulp wood and the manufacture of print paper for which we have make a conditional provision in the agreement believe to be equitable should we not now therefore before their policy have become too crystallized and fix for change meet they in a spirit of real concession facilitate commerce between the two country and thus greatly increase the natural resource available to our people
 i do not wish to hold out the prospect that the unrestricted interchange of food product will greatly and at once reduce their cost to the people of this country moreover the present small amount of canadian surplus for export as compare with that of our own production and consumption would make the reduction gradual exclude the element of transportation the price of staple food product especially of cereal be much the same the world over and the recent increase in price have be the result of a world wide cause but a source of supply as near as canada would certainly help to prevent speculative fluctuation would steady local price movement and would postpone the effect of a further world increase in the price of lead commodity enter into the cost of living if that be inevitable
 in the reciprocal trade agreement numerous addition be make to the free list these include not only food commodity such as cattle fish wheat and other grain fresh vegetable fruit and dairy product but also rough lumber and raw material useful to our own industry free lumber we ought to have by give our people access to canadian forest we shall reduce the consumption of our own which in the hand of comparatively few owner now have a value that require the enlargement of our available timber resource
 natural and especially food product be place on the free list the logical development of a policy of reciprocity in rate on secondary food product or foodstuff partly manufacture be where they can not also be entirely exempt from duty to lower the duty in accord with the exemption of the raw material from duty this have be follow in the trade agreement which have be negotiate as an example wheat be make free and the rate on flour be equalize on a low basis in the same way live animal be make free the duty on fresh meat and on secondary meat product and on canned meat be substantially lower fresh fruit and vegetable be place on the free list the duty on can good of these class be reduce
 both country in their industrial development have to meet the competition of lower price labor in other part of the world both follow the policy of encourage the development of home industry by protective duty within reasonable limit this have make it difficult to extend the principle of reciprocal rate to many manufactured commodity but after much negotiation and effort we have succeed in do so in various and important instance
 the benefit to our widespread agricultural implement industry from the reduction of canadian duty in the agreement be clear similarly the new widely distribute and expand motor vehicle industry of the united states be give access to the dominion market on advantageous term
 my purpose in make a reciprocal trade agreement with canada have be not only to obtain one which would be mutually advantageous to both country but one which also would be truly national in its scope as apply to our own country and would be of benefit to all section the current of business and the transportation facility that will be establish forward and back across the border can not but inure to the benefit of the boundary state some readjustment may be need but in a very short period the advantage of the free commercial exchange between community separate only by short distance will strikingly manifest itself that the broadening of the source of food supply that the opening of the timber resource of the dominion to our need that the addition to the supply of raw material will be limit to no particular section do not require demonstration the same observation apply to the market which the dominion offer we in exchange as an illustration it have be find possible to obtain free entry into canada for fresh fruit and vegetable a matter of special value to the south and to the pacific coast in dispose of their product in their season it also have be practicable to obtain free entry for the cottonseed oil of the south-- a most important product with a rapidly expand consumption in the dominion
 the entire foreign trade of canada in the last fiscal year 1910 be $ 655,000,000 the import be $ 376,000,000 and of this amount the united states contribute more than $ 223,000,000 the reduction in the duty impose by canada will largely increase this amount and give we even a large share of her market than we now enjoy great as that be
 the datum accompany the text of the trade agreement exhibit in detail the fact which be here set forth briefly and in outline only they furnish full information on which the legislation recommend may be base action on the agreement submit will not interfere with such revision of our own tariff on import from all country as congress may decide to adopt
 reciprocity with canada must necessarily be chiefly confine in its effect on the cost of live to food and forest product the question of the cost of clothing as affect by duty on textile and their raw material so much moot be not within the scope of an agreement with canada because she raise comparatively few wool sheep and her textile manufacture be unimportant
 this trade agreement if enter into will cement the friendly relation with the dominion which have result from the satisfactory settlement of the controversy that have last for a century and far promote good feeling between kindre people it will extend the market for numerous product of the united states among the inhabitant of a prosperous neighboring country with an increase population and an increase purchasing power it will deepen and widen the source of food supply in contiguous territory and will facilitate the movement and distribution of these foodstuff
 the geographical proximity the close relation of blood common sympathy and identical moral and social idea furnish very real and strike reason why this agreement ought to be view from a high plane
 since become a nation canada have be our good neighbor immediately contiguous across a wide continent without artificial or natural barrier except navigable water use in common
 she have cost we nothing in the way of preparation for defense against her possible assault and she never will she have seek to agree with we quickly when difference have disturb our relation she share with us common tradition and aspiration i feel i have correctly interpret the wish of the american people by express in the arrangement now submit to congress for its approval their desire for a more intimate and cordial relationship with canada i therefore earnestly hope that the measure will be promptly enact into law

to the senate and house of representatives

 this message be the first of several which i shall send to congress during the interval between the opening of its regular session and its adjournment for the christmas holiday the amount of information to be communicate as to the operation of the government the number of important subject call for comment by the executive and the transmission to congress of exhaustive report of special commission make it impossible to include in one message of a reasonable length a discussion of the topic that ought to be bring to the attention of the national legislature at its first regular session

 the anti trust law the supreme court decision

 in may last the supreme court hand down decision in the suit in equity bring by the united states to enjoin the further maintenance of the standard oil trust and of the american tobacco trust and to secure their dissolution the decision be epoch making and serve to advise the business world authoritatively of the scope and operation of the anti trust act of 1890 the decision do not depart in any substantial way from the previous decision of the court in construe and apply this important statute but they clarify those decision by far define the already admit exception to the literal construction of the act by the decree they furnish a useful precedent as to the proper method of deal with the capital and property of illegal trust these decision suggest the need and wisdom of additional or supplemental legislation to make it easy for the entire business community to square with the rule of action and legality thus finally establish and to preserve the benefit freedom and spur of reasonable competition without loss of real efficiency or progress

 no change in the rule of decision merely in its form of expression

 the statute in its first section declare to be illegal every contract combination in the form of trust or otherwise or conspiracy in restraint of trade or commerce among the several states or with foreign nation and in the second declare guilty of a misdemeanor every person who shall monopolize or attempt to monopolize or combine or conspire with any other person to monopolize any part of the trade or commerce of the several states or with foreign nation

 in two early case where the statute be invoke to enjoin a transportation rate agreement between interstate railroad company it be hold that it be no defense to show that the agreement as to rate complain of be reasonable at common law because it be say that the statute be direct against all contract and combination in restraint of trade whether reasonable at common law or not it be plain from the record however that the contract complain of in those case would not have be deem reasonable at common law in subsequent case the court say that the statute should be give a reasonable construction and refuse to include within its inhibition certain contractual restraint of trade which it denominate as incidental or as indirect

 these case of restraint of trade that the court except from the operation of the statute be instance which at common law would have be call reasonable in the standard oil and tobacco case therefore the court merely adopt the test of the common law and in define exception to the literal application of the statute only substitute for the test of be incidental or indirect that of be reasonable and this without vary in the slight the actual scope and effect of the statute in other word all the case under the statute which have now be decide would have be decide the same way if the court have originally accept in its construction the rule at common law

 it have be say that the court by introduce into the construction of the statute common law distinction have emasculate it this be obviously untrue by its judgment every contract and combination in restraint of interstate trade make with the purpose or necessary effect of control price by stifle competition or of establish in whole or in part a monopoly of such trade be condemn by the statute the most extreme critic can not instance a case that ought to be condemn under the statute which be not bring within its term as thus construe

 the suggestion be also make that the supreme court by its decision in the last two case have commit to the court the undefined and unlimited discretion to determine whether a case of restraint of trade be within the term of the statute this be wholly untrue a reasonable restraint of trade at common law be well understand and be clearly define it do not rest in the discretion of the court it must be limit to accomplish the purpose of a lawful main contract to which in order that it shall be enforceable at all it must be incidental if it exceed the need of that contract it be void

 the test of reasonableness be never apply by the court at common law to contract or combination or conspiracy in restraint of trade whose purpose be or whose necessary effect would be to stifle competition to control price or establish monopoly the court never assume power to say that such contract or combination or conspiracy might be lawful if the party to they be only moderate in the use of the power thus secure and do not exact from the public too great and exorbitant price it be true that many theorist and other engage in business violate the statute have hope that some such line could be draw by court but no court of authority have ever attempt it certainly there be nothing in the decision of the late two case from which such a dangerous theory of judicial discretion in enforce this statute can derive the slight sanction

 force and effectiveness of statute a matter of growth

 we have be twenty one year make this statute effective for the purpose for which it be enact the knight case be discourage and seem to remit to the states the whole available power to attack and suppress the evil of the trust slowly however the error of that judgment be correct and only in the last three or four year have the heavy hand of the law be lay upon the great illegal combination that have exercise such an absolute dominion over many of our industry criminal prosecution have be bring and a number be pende but jury have feel averse to convict for jail sentence and judge have be most reluctant to impose such sentence on man of respectable standing in society whose offense have be regard as merely statutory still as the offense becomes well understand and the committing of it partake more of studied and deliberate defiance of the law we can be confident that jury will convict individual and that jail sentence will be impose

 the remedy in equity by dissolution

 in the standard oil case the supreme and circuit courts find the combination to be a monopoly of the interstate business of refining transporting and market petroleum and its product effect and maintain through thirty seven different corporation the stock of which be hold by a new jersey company it in effect command the dissolution of this combination direct the transfer and pro rata distribution by the new jersey company of the stock hold by it in the thirty seven corporation to and among its stockholder and the corporation and individual defendant be enjoin from conspire or combine to restore such monopoly and all agreement between the subsidiary corporation tend to produce or bring about further violation of the act be enjoin

 in the tobacco case the court find that the individual defendant twenty nine in number have be engage in a successful effort to acquire complete dominion over the manufacture sale and distribution of tobacco in this country and abroad and that this have be do by combination make with a purpose and effect to stifle competition control price and establish a monopoly not only in the manufacture of tobacco but also of tin foil and licorice use in its manufacture and of its product of cigar cigarette and snuff the tobacco suit present a far more complicated and difficult case than the standard oil suit for a decree which would effectuate the will of the court and end the violation of the statute there be here no single hold company as in the case of the standard oil trust the main company be the american tobacco company a manufacturing selling and hold company the plan adopt to destroy the combination and restore competition involve the redivision of the capital and plant of the whole trust between some of the company constitute the trust and new company organize for the purpose of the decree and make party to it and numbering new and old fourteen

 situation after readjustment

 the american tobacco company old readjust capital $ 92 000,000 the liggett amp meyers tobacco company new capital $ 67,000,000 the p. lorillard company new capital $ 47,000,000 and the r. j. reynolds tobacco company old capital $ 7,525,000 be chiefly engage in the manufacture and sale of chew and smoke tobacco and cigar the former one tinfoil company be divide into two one of $ 825,000 capital and the other of $ 400,000 the one snuff company be divide into three company one with a capital of $ 15,000,000 another with a capital of $ 8,000,000 and a third with a capital of $ 8,000,000 the licorice company be two one with a capital of $ 5,758,300 and another with a capital of $ 200,000 there be also the british american tobacco company a british corporation do business abroad with a capital of $ 26,000,000 the porto rican tobacco company with a capital of $ 1,800,000 and the corporation of united cigar stores with a capital of $ 9,000,000

 under this arrangement each of the different kind of business will be distribute between two or more company with a division of the prominent brand in the same tobacco product so as to make competition not only possible but necessary thus the smoking tobacco business of the country be divide so that the present independent company have 21 39 per cent while the american tobacco company will have 33 08 per cent the liggett amp meyers 20.05 per cent the lorillard company 22.82 per cent and the reynolds company 2.66 per cent the stock of the other thirteen company both preferred and common have be take from the defendant american tobacco company and have be distribute among its stockholder all covenant restrict competition have be declare null and further performance of they have be enjoin the preferred stock of the different company have now be give voting power which be deny it under the old organization the ratio of the preferred stock to the common be as 78 to 40 this constitute a very decide change in the character of the ownership and control of each company

 in the original suit there be twenty nine defendant who be charge with be the conspirator through whom the illegal combination acquire and exercise its unlawful dominion under the decree these defendant will hold amount of stock in the various distributee company range from 41 per cent as a maximum to 28.5 per cent as a minimum except in the case of one small company the porto rican tobacco company in which they will hold 45 per cent the twenty nine individual defendant be enjoin for three year from buy any stock except from each other and the group be thus prevent from extend its control during that period all party to the suit and the new company who be make party be enjoin perpetually from in any way effect any combination between any of the company in violation of the statute by way of resumption of the old trust each of the fourteen company be enjoin from acquire stock in any of the other all these company be enjoin from have common director or officer or common buying or sell agent or common office or lend money to each other

 size of new company

 objection be make by certain independent tobacco company that this settlement be unjust because it leave company with very large capital in active business and that the settlement that would be effective to put all on an equality would be a division of the capital and plant of the trust into small fraction in amount more nearly equal to that of each of the independent company this contention result from a misunderstanding of the anti trust law and its purpose it be not intend thereby to prevent the accumulation of large capital in business enterprise in which such a combination can secure reduce cost of production sale and distribution it be direct against such an aggregation of capital only when its purpose be that of stifle competition enhance or control price and establish a monopoly if we shall have by the decree defeat these purpose and restore competition between the large unit into which the capital and plant have be divide we shall have accomplish the useful purpose of the statute

 confiscation not the purpose of the statute

 it be not the purpose of the statute to confiscate the property and capital of the offend trust method of punishment by fine or imprisonment of the individual offender by fine of the corporation or by forfeiture of its good in transportation be provide but the proceeding in equity be a specific remedy to stop the operation of the trust by injunction and prevent the future use of the plant and capital in violation of the statute

 effectiveness of decree

 i venture to say that not in the history of american law have a decree more effective for such a purpose be enter by a court than that against the tobacco trust as circuit judge noyes say in his judgment approve the decree

 the extent to which it have be necessary to tear apart this combination and force it into new form with the attendant burden ought to demonstrate that the federal anti trust statute be a drastic statute which accomplish effective result which so long as it stand on the statute book must be obey and which can not be disobey without incur far reach penalty and on the other hand the successful reconstruction of this organization should teach that the effect of enforce this statute be not to destroy but to reconstruct not to demolish but to re create in accordance with the condition which the congress have declare shall exist among the people of the united states

 common stock ownership

 it have be assume that the present pro rata and common ownership in all these company by former stockholder of the trust would insure a continuance of the same old single control of all the company into which the trust have by decree be disintegrate this be erroneous and be base upon the assumed inefficacy and innocuousness of judicial injunction the company be enjoin from cooperation or combination they have different manager director purchasing and sale agent if all or many of the numerous stockholder reach into the thousand attempt to secure concert action of the company with a view to the control of the market their number be so large that such an attempt could not well be conceal and its prime mover and all its participant would be at once subject to contempt proceeding and imprisonment of a summary character the immediate result of the present situation will necessarily be activity by all the company under different manager and then competition must follow or there will be activity by one company and stagnation by another only a short time will inevitably lead to a change in ownership of the stock as all opportunity for continue cooperation must disappear those critic who speak of this dis

 integration in the trust as a mere change of garment have not give consideration to the inevitable working of the decree and understand little the personal danger of attempt to evade or set at naught the solemn injunction of a court whose object be make plain by the decree and whose inhibition be set forth with a detail and comprehensiveness

 voluntary reorganization of other trust at hand

 the effect of these two decision have lead to decree dissolve the combination of manufacturer of electric lamp a southern wholesale grocer association an interlocutory decree against the powder trust with direction by the circuit court compelling dissolution and other combination of a similar history be now negotiate with the department of justice look to a disintegration by decree and reorganization in accordance with law it seem possible to bring about these reorganization without general business disturbance

 movement for repeal of the anti trust law

 but now that the anti trust act be see to be effective for the accomplishment of the purpose of its enactment we be meet by a cry from many different quarter for its repeal it be say to be obstructive of business progress to be an attempt to restore old fashioned method of destructive competition between small unit and to make impossible those useful combination of capital and the reduction of the cost of production that be essential to continue prosperity and normal growth

 in the recent decision the supreme court make clear that there be nothing in the statute which condemn combination of capital or mere bigness of plant organize to secure economy in production and a reduction of its cost it be only when the purpose or necessary effect of the organization and maintenance of the combination or the aggregation of immense size be the stifling of competition actual and potential and the enhancing of price and establish a monopoly that the statute be violate mere size be no sin against the law the merging of two or more business plant necessarily eliminate competition between the unit thus combine but this elimination be in contravention of the statute only when the combination be make for purpose of end this particular competition in order to secure control of and enhance price and create a monopoly

 lack of definiteness in the statute

 the complaint be make of the statute that it be not sufficiently definite in its description of that which be forbid to enable business man to avoid its violation the suggestion be that we may have a combination of two corporation which may run on for year and that subsequently the attorney general may conclude that it wa be a violation of the statute and that which be suppose by the combiner to be innocent then turn out to be a combination in violation of the statute the answer to this hypothetical case be that when man attempt to amass such stupendous capital as will enable they to suppress competition control price and establish a monopoly they know the purpose of their act man do not do such a thing without have it clearly in mind if what they do be merely for the purpose of reduce the cost of production without the thought of suppress competition by use of the bigness of the plant they be create then they can not be convict at the time the union be make nor can they be convict later unless it happen that later on they conclude to suppress competition and take the usual method for do so and thus establish for themselves a monopoly they can in such a case hardly complain if the motive which subsequently be disclose be attribute by the court to the original combination

 new remedy suggest

 much be say of the repeal of this statute and of constructive legislation intend to accomplish the purpose and blaze a clear path for honest merchant and business man to follow it may be that such a plan will be evolve but i submit that the discussion which have be bring out in recent day by the fear of the continued execution of the anti trust law have produce nothing but glitter generality and have offer no line of distinction or rule of action as definite and as clear as that which the supreme court itself lay down in enforce the statute

 supplemental legislation needed not repeal or amendment

 i see no objection and indeed i can see decide advantage in the enactment of a law which shall describe and denounce method of competition which be unfair and be badge of the unlawful purpose denounce in the anti trust law the attempt and purpose to suppress a competitor by undersell he at a price so unprofitable as to drive he out of business or the making of exclusive contract with customer under which they be require to give up association with other manufacturer and numerous kindre method for stifle competition and effecting monopoly should be describe with sufficient accuracy in a criminal statute on the one hand to enable the government to shorten its task by prosecute single misdemeanor instead of an entire conspiracy and on the other hand to serve the purpose of point out more in detail to the business community what must be avoid

 federal incorporation recommended

 in a special message to congress on january 7 1910 i venture to point out the disturbance to business that would probably attend the dissolution of these offending trust i say

 but such an investigation and possible prosecution of corporation whose prosperity or destruction affect the comfort not only of stockholder but of million of wage earner employee and associate tradesman must necessarily tend to disturb the confidence of the business community to dry up the now flow source of capital from its place of hoarding and produce a halt in our present prosperity that will cause suffering and strained circumstance among the innocent many for the fault of the guilty few the question which i wish in this message to bring clearly to the consideration and discussion of congress be whether in order to avoid such a possible business danger something can not be do by which these business combination may be offer a mean without great financial disturbance of change the character organization and extent of their business into one within the line of the law under federal control and supervision secure compliance with the anti trust statute

 generally in the industrial combination call trust the principal business be the sale of good in many state and in foreign market in other word the interstate and foreign business far exceed the business do in any one state this fact will justify the federal government in grant a federal charter to such a combination to make and sell in interstate and foreign commerce the product of useful manufacture under such limitation as will secure a compliance with the anti trust law it be possible so to frame a statute that while it offer protection to a federal company against harmful vexatious and unnecessary invasion by the states it shall subject it to reasonable taxation and control by the states with respect to its purely local business

 corporation organize under this act should be prohibit from acquire and hold stock in other corporation except for special reason upon approval by the proper federal authority thus avoid the creation under national auspex of the hold company with subordinate corporation in different states which have be such an effective agency in the creation of the great trust and monopoly

 if the prohibition of the anti trust act against combination in restraint of trade be to be effectively enforce it be essential that the national government shall provide for the creation of national corporation to carry on a legitimate business throughout the united states the conflict law of the different states of the union with respect to foreign corporation make it difficult if not impossible for one corporation to comply with their requirement so as to carry on business in a number of different state

 i renew the recommendation of the enactment of a general law provide for the voluntary formation of corporation to engage in trade and commerce among the states and with foreign nation every argument which be then advanced for such a law and every explanation which be at that time offer to possible objection have be confirm by our experience since the enforcement of the antitrust statute have result in the actual dissolution of active commercial organization

 it be even more manifest now than it be then that the denunciation of conspiracy in restraint of trade should not and do not mean the denial of organization large enough to be intrust with our interstate and foreign trade it have be make more clear now than it be then that a purely negative statute like the anti trust law may well be supplement by specific provision for the building up and regulation of legitimate national and foreign commerce

 government administrative expert need to aid courts in trust dissolution

 the drafting of the decree in the dissolution of the present trust with a view to their reorganization into legitimate corporation have make it especially apparent that the court be not provide with the administrative machinery to make the necessary inquiry preparatory to reorganization or to pursue such inquiry and they should be empower to invoke the aid of the bureau of corporations in determine the suitable reorganization of the disintegrate part the circuit court and the attorney general be greatly aid in frame the decree in the tobacco trust dissolution by an expert from the bureau of corporations

 federal corporation commission proposed

 i do not set forth in detail the term and section of a statute which might supply the constructive legislation permit and aid the formation of combination of capital into federal corporation they should be subject to rigid rule as to their organization and procedure include effective publicity and to the close supervision as to the issue of stock and bond by an executive bureau or commission in the department of commerce and labor to which in time of doubt they might well submit their propose plan for future business it must be distinctly understand that incorporation under federal law could not exempt the company thus form and its incorporator and manager from prosecution under the anti trust law for subsequent illegal conduct but the publicity of its procedure and the opportunity for frequent consultation with the bureau or commission in charge of the incorporation as to the legitimate purpose of its transaction would offer it as great security against successful prosecution for violation of the law as would be practical or wise

 stich a bureau or commission might well be invest also with the duty already refer to of aid court in the dissolution and recreation of trust within the law it should be an executive tribunal of the dignity and power of the comptroller of the currency or the interstate commerce commission which now exercise supervisory power over important class of corporation under federal regulation

 the drafting of such a federal incorporation law would offer ample opportunity to prevent many manifest evil in corporate management to day include irresponsibility of control in the hand of the few who be not the real owner

 incorporation voluntary

 i recommend that the federal charter thus to be grant shall be voluntary at least until experience justify mandatory provision the benefit to be derive from the operation of great business under the protection of such a charter would attract all who be anxious to keep within the line of the law other large combination that fail to take advantage of the federal incorporation will not have a right to complain if their failure be ascribe to unwillingness to submit their transaction to the careful official scrutiny competent supervision and publicity attendant upon the enjoyment of such a charter

 only supplemental legislation needed

 the opportunity thus suggest for federal incorporation it seem tome be suitable constructive legislation need to facilitate the squaring of great industrial enterprise to the rule of action lay down by the anti trust law this statute as construe by the supreme court must continue to be the line of distinction for legitimate business it must be enforce unless we be to banish individualism from all business and reduce it to one common system of regulation or control of price like that which now prevail with respect to public utility and which when apply to all business would be a long step toward state socialism

 importance of the anti trust act

 the anti trust act be the expression of the effort of a freedomlove people to preserve equality of opportunity it be the result of the confident determination of such a people to maintain their future growth by preserve uncontrolle and unrestricte the enterprise of the individual his industry his ingenuity his intelligence and his independent courage

 for twenty year or more this statute have be upon the statute book all know its general purpose and approve many of its violator be cynical over its assumed impotence it seem impossible of enforcement slowly the mill of the court ground and only gradually do the majesty of the law assert itself many of its statesman author die before it become a living force and they and other see the evil grow which they have hope to destroy now its efficacy be see now its power be heavy now its object be near achievement now we hear the call for its repeal on the plea that it interfere with business prosperity and we be advise in most general term how by some other statute and in some other way the evil we be just stamp out can be cure if we only abandon this work of twenty year and try another experiment for another term of year

 it be say that the act have not do good can this be say in the face of the effect of the northern securities decree that decree be in no way so drastic or inhibitive in detail as either the standard oil decree or the tobacco decree but do it not stop for all time the then powerful movement toward the control of all the railroad of the country in a single hand such a one man power could not have be a healthful influence in the republic even though exercise under the general supervision of an interstate commission

 do we desire to make such ruthless combination and monopoly lawful when all energy be direct not toward the reduction of the cost of production for the public benefit by a healthful competition but toward new way and mean for make permanent in a few hand the absolute control of the condition and price prevail in the whole field of industry then individual enterprise and effort will be paralyze and the spirit of commercial freedom will be dead

 part ii

 on foreign relations

 the white house december 7 1911

 to the senate and house of representatives

 the relation of the united states with other country have continue during the past twelve month upon a basis of the usual good will and friendly intercourse

 arbitration

 the year just pass mark an important general movement on the part of the powers for broad arbitration in the recognition of the manifold benefit to mankind in the extension of the policy of the settlement of international dispute by arbitration rather than by war and in response to a widespread demand for an advance in that direction on the part of the people of the united states and of great britain and of france new arbitration treaty be negotiate last spring with great britain and france the term of which be de sign as express in the preamble of these treaty to extend the scope and obligation of the policy of arbitration adopt in our present treaty with those government to pave the way for this treat with the united states great britain negotiate an important modification in its alliance with japan and the french government also expedite the negotiation with signal good will the new treaty have be submit to the senate and be await its advice and consent to their ratification all the essential of these important treaty have long be know and it be my earnest hope that they will receive prompt and favorable action

 claim of alsop amp co settled

 i be glad to report that on july 5 last the american claim of alsop amp co. against the government of chile be finally dispose of by the decision of his britannic majesty george v to whom as amiable compositeur the matter have be refer for determination his majesty make an award of nearly $ 1,000,000 to the claimant which be promptly pay by chile the settlement of this controversy have happily eliminate from the relation between the republic of chile and the united states the only question which for two decade have give the two foreign office any serious concern and make possible the unobstructed development of the relation of friendship which it have be the aim of this government in every possible way to far and cultivate

 arbitration panama and costa rica colombia and haiti

 in further illustration of the practical and beneficent application of the principle of arbitration and the underlie broad spirit of conciliation i be happy to advert to the part of the united states in facilitate amicable settlement of dispute which menace the peace between panama and costa rica and between haiti and the dominican republic

 since the date of their independence colombia and costa rica have be seek a solution of a boundary dispute which come as an heritage from colombia to the new republic of panama upon its begin life as an independent nation although the disputant have submit this question for decision to the president of france under the term of an arbitration treaty the exact interpretation of the provision of the award render have be a matter of serious disagreement between the two country both contend for widely different line even under the term of the decision subsequently and since t903 this boundary question bad be the subject of fruitless diplomatic negotiation between the party in january 1910 at the request of both government the agent represent they meet in conference at the department of state and subsequently conclude a protocol submit this long pende controversy to the arbitral judgment of the chief justice of the united states who consent to act in this capacity a boundary commission accord to the international agreement have now be appoint and it be expect that the argument will shortly proceed and that this long stand dispute will be honorably and satisfactorily terminate

 again a few month ago it appear that the dominican republic and haiti be about to enter upon hostility because of complication grow out of an acrimonious boundary dispute which the effort of many year have fail to solve the government of the united states by a friendly interposition of good office succeed in prevail upon the party to place their reliance upon some form of pacific settlement accordingly on the friendly suggestion of this government the two government empower commissioner to meet at washington in conference at the state department in order to arrange the term of submission to arbitration of the boundary controversy

 chamizal arbitration not satisfactory

 our arbitration of the chamizal boundary question with mexico be unfortunately abortive but with the earnest effort on the part of both government which its importance command it be feel that an early practical adjustment should prove possible

 latin america

 venezuela

 during the past year the republic of venezuela celebrate the one hundredth anniversary of its independence the united states send in honor of this event a special embassy to caracas where the cordial reception and generous hospitality show it be most gratifying as a further proof of the good relation and friendship exist between that country and the united states

 mexico

 the recent political event in mexico receive attention from this government because of the exceedingly delicate and difficult situation create along our southern border and the necessity for take measure properly to safeguard american interest the government of the united states in its desire to secure a proper observance and enforcement of the so call neutrality statute of the federal government issue direction to the appropriate officer to exercise a diligent and vigilant regard for the requirement of such rule and law although a condition of actual armed conflict exist there be no official recognition of belligerency involve the technical neutrality obligation of international law

 on the 6th of march last in the absence of the secretary of state i have a personal interview with mr. wilson the ambassador of the united states to mexico in which he report to i that the condition in mexico be much more critical than the press dispatch disclose that president diaz be on a volcano of popular uprising that the small outbreak which have occur be only symptomatic of the whole condition that a very large per cent of the people be in sympathy with the insurrection that a general explosion be probable at any time in which case he fear that the 40,000 or more american resident in mexico might be assail and that the very large american investment might be injure or destroy

 after a conference with the secretary of war and the secretary of the navy i think it wise to assemble an army division of full strength at san antonio tex a brigade of three regiment at galveston a brigade of infantry in the los angeles district of southern california together with a squadron of battleship and cruiser and transport at galveston and a small squadron of ship at san diego at the same time through our representative at the city of mexico i express to president diaz the hope that no apprehension might result from unfounded conjecture as to these military maneuver and assure he that they have no significance which should cause concern to his government

 the mobilization be effect with great promptness and on the 15th of march through the secretary of war and the secretary of the navy in a letter address to the chief of staff i issue the following instruction

 it seem my duty as commander in chief to place troop in sufficient number where if congress shall direct that they enter mexico to save american life and property an effective movement may be promptly make meantime the movement of the troop to texas and elsewhere near the boundary accompany with sincere assurance of the utmost goodwill toward the present mexican government and with large and more frequent patrol along the border to prevent insurrectionary expedition from american soil will hold up the hand of the exist government and will have a healthy moral effect to prevent attack upon americans and their property in any subsequent general internecine strife again the sudden mobilization of a division of troop have be a great test of our army and full of useful instruction while the maneuver that be thus make possible can occupy the troop and their officer to great advantage

 the assumption by the press that i contemplate intervention on mexican soil to protect american life or property be of course gratuitous because i seriously doubt whether i have such authority under any circumstance and if i have i would not exercise it without express congressional approval indeed as you know i have already decline without mexican consent to order a troop of cavalry to protect the breakwater we be construct just across the border in mexico at the mouth of the colorado river to save the imperial valley although the insurrecto have scatter the mexican troop and be take our horse and supply and frightening our workman away my determined purpose however be to be in a position so that when danger to american life and property in mexico threaten and the exist government be render helpless by the insurrection i can promptly execute congressional order to protect they with effect

 meantime i send you this letter through the secretary to call your attention to some thing in connection with the presence of the division in the southwest which have doubtless occur to you but which i wish to emphasize

 in the first place i want to make the mobilization a first class training for the army and i wish you would give your time and that of the war college to advise and carry out maneuver of a useful character and plan to continue to do this during the next three month by that time we may expect that either ambassador wilson 's fear will have be realize and chaos and its consequence have ensue or that the present government of mexico will have so readjust matter as to secure tranquillity a result devoutly to be wish the troop can then be return to their post i understand from you in washington that gen. aleshire say that you could probably meet all the additional expense of this whole movement out of the present appropriation if the troop continue in texas for three month i sincerely hope this be so i observe from the newspaper that you have no blank cartridge but i presume that this be an error or that it will be easy to procure those for use as soon as your maneuver begin

 second texas be a state ordinarily peaceful but you can not put 20,000 troop into it without run some risk of a collision between the people of that state and especially the -mexican who live in texas near the border and who sympathize with the insurrecto and the federal soldier for that reason i beg you to be as careful as you can to prevent friction of any kind we be able in cuba with the army of pacification there of something more than 5,000 troop to maintain they for a year without any trouble and i hope you can do the same thing in texas please give your attention to this and advise all the officer in command of the necessity for very great circumspection in this regard

 third one of the great trouble in the concentration of troop be the danger of disease and i suppose that you have adopt the most modern method for prevent and if necessary for stamp out epidemic that be so much a part of a campaign that it hardly seem necessary for i to call attention to it

 finally i wish you to examine the question of the patrol of the border and put as many troop on that work as be practicable and more than be now engage in it in order to prevent the use of our borderland for the carrying out of the insurrection i have give assurance to the mexican ambassador on this point

 i sincerely hope that this experience will always be remember by the army and navy as a useful mean of education and i should be greatly disappointed if it result in any injury or disaster to our force from any cause i have take a good deal of responsibility in order this mobilization but i be ready to answer for it if only you and those under you use the utmost care to avoid the difficulty which i have point out

 you may have a copy of this letter make and leave with gen. carter and such other general in command as you may think wise and necessary to guide they in their course but to be regard as confidential

 i be more than happy to here record the fact that all apprehension as to the effect of the presence of so large a military force in texas prove groundless no disturbance occur the conduct of the troop be exemplary and the public reception and treatment of they be all that could have be desire and this notwithstanding the presence of a large number of mexican refugee in the border territory

 from time to time communication be receive from ambassador wilson who have return to mexico confirm the view that the massing of american troop in the neighborhood have have good effect by dispatch of april 3 1911 the ambassador say

 the continue gravity of the situation here and the chaos that would ensue should the constitutional authority be eventually overthrow thus greatly increase the danger to which american life and property be already subject confirm the wisdom of the president in take those military precaution which make every allowance for the dignity and the sovereignty of a friendly state be due to our national abroad

 charge as i be with the responsibility of safeguard these life and property i be bind to say to the department that our military disposition on the frontier have produce an effective impression on the mexican mind and may at any moment prove to be the only guaranty for the safety of our national and their property if it should eventuate that condition here require more active measure by the president and congress sporadic attack might be make upon the life and property of our national but the ultimate result would be order and adequate protection

 the insurrection continue and result in engagement between the regular mexican troop and the insurgent and this along the border so that in several instance bullet from the contending force strike american citizen engage in their lawful occupation on american soil

 proper protest be make against these invasion of american right to the mexican authority on april 17 1911 1 receive the follow telegram from the governor of arizona

 as a result of to day 's fighting across the international line but within gunshot range of the heart of douglas five americans wound on this side of the line everything point to repetition of these casualty on to morrow and while the federal seem disposed to keep their agreement not to fire into douglas the position of the insurrectionist be such that when fighting occur on the east and southeast of the intrenchment people live in douglas be put in danger of their life in my judgment radical measure be need to protect our innocent people and if anything can be do to stop the fighting at agua prieta the ittiation call for such action it be impossible to safeguard the people of douglas unless the town be vacate can anything be do to relieve situation now acute

 after a conference with the secretary of state the follow telegram be send to governor sloan on april is 1911 9 11 and make public

 your dispatch receive have make urgent demand upon mexican government to issue instruction to prevent fire across border by mexican federal troop and be wait reply meantime i have send direct warning to the mexican and insurgent force near douglas i infer from your dispatch that both party attempt to heed the warning but that in the strain and exigency of the contest wild bullet still find their way into douglas the situation might justify i in order our troop to cross the border and attempt to stop the fighting or to fire upon both combatant from the american side but if i take this step i must face the possibility of resistance and great bloodshed and also the danger of have our motive misconstrue and misrepresent and of thus inflame mexican popular indignation against many thousand americans now in mexico and jeopardize their life and property the pressure for general intervention under such condition it might not be practicable to resist it be impossible to foresee or reckon the consequence of such a course and we must use the great self restraint to avoid it pende my urgent representation to the mexican government i can not therefore order the troop at douglas to cross the border but i must ask you and the local authority in case the same danger recur to direct the people of douglas to place themselves where bullet can not reach they and thus avoid casualty i be loath to endanger americans in mexico where they be necessarily expose by take a radical step to prevent injury to americans on our side of the border who can avoid it by a temporary inconvenience

 i be glad to say that no further invasion of american right of any substantial character occur

 the presence of a large military and naval force available for prompt action near the mexican border prove to be most fortunate under the somewhat try condition present by this invasion of american right have no movement theretofore take place and because of these event it have be necessary then to bring about the mobilization it must have bad sinister significance on the other hand the presence of the troop before and at the time of the unfortunate killing and wounding of american citizen at douglas make clear that the restraint exercise by our government in regard to this occurrence be not due to lack of force or power to deal with it promptly and aggressively but be due to a real desire to use every mean possible to avoid direct intervention in the affair of our neighbor whose friendship we value and be most anxious to retain

 the policy and action of this government be base upon an earnest friendliness for the mexican people as a whole and it be a matter of gratification to note that this attitude of strict impartiality as to all faction in mexico and of sincere friendship for the neighboring nation without regard for party allegiance have be generally recognize and have result in an even close and more sympathetic understanding between the two republics and a warm regard one for the other action to suppress violence and restore tranquillity throughout the mexican republic be of peculiar interest to this government in that it concern the safeguarding of american life and property in that country the government of the united states have occasion to accord permission for the passage of a body of mexican rurale through douglas arizona to tia juana mexico for the suppression of general lawlessness which bad for some time exist in the region of northern lower california on may 25 1911 president diaz resign senor de la barra be choose provisional president election for president and vice president be thereafter hold throughout the republic and senor francisco 1 madero be formally declare elect on october 15 to the chief magistracy on november 6 president madero enter upon the duty of his office

 since the inauguration of president madero a plot have be unearth against the present government to begin a new insurrection pursue the same consistent policy which this administration have adopt from the beginning it direct an investigation into the conspiracy charge and this investigation have result in the indictment of gen. bernardo reyes and other and the seizure of a number of officer and man and horse and accoutrement assemble upon the soil of texas for the purpose of invade mexico similar proceeding have be take during the insurrection against the diaz government result in the indictment and prosecution of person find to be engage in violate the neutrality law of the united states in aid of that uprising

 the record of this government in respect of the recognition of constituted authority in mexico therefore be clear

 central america honduras and nicaragua treaty propose

 as to the situation in central america i have take occasion in the past to emphasize most strongly the importance that should be attribute to the consummation of the convention between the republics of nicaragua and of honduras and this country and i again earnestly recommend that the necessary advice and consent of the senate be accord to these treaty which will make it possible for these central american republics to enter upon an era of genuine economic national development the government of nicaragua which have already take favorable action on the convention have find it necessary pende the exchange of final ratification to enter into negotiation with american banker for the purpose of secure a temporary loan to relieve the present financial tension iii connection with this temporary loan and in the hope of consummate through the ultimate operation of the convention a complete and lasting economic regeneration the government of nicaragua have also decide to engage an american citizen as collector general of custom the claim commission on which the service of two american citizen have be seek and the work of the american financial adviser should accomplish a lasting good of inestimable benefit to the prosperity commerce and peace of the republic in consider the ratification of the convention with nicaragua and honduras there rest with the united states the heavy responsibility of the fact that their rejection here might destroy the progress make and consign the republic concerned to still deep submergence in bankruptcy revolution and national jeopardy

 the far east

 the chinese loans

 the past year have be mark in our relation with china by the conclusion of two important international loan one for the construction of the hukuang railway the other for carry out of the currency reform to which china be pledge by treaty with the united states great britain and japan of which mention be make in my last annual message

 it will be remember that early in 1909 an agreement be consummate among british french and german financial group whereby they propose to lend the chinese government fund for the construction of railway in the provinces of hunan and hupeh reserve for their national the privilege of engineer the construction of the line and of furnish the material require for the work after negotiation with the governments and group concern an agreement be reach whereby american british french and german national should participate upon equal term in this important and useful undertaking thereupon the financial group support by their respective government begin negotiation with the chinese government which terminate in a loan to china of $ 30,000,000 with the privilege of increase the amount to $ 50,000,000 the cooperative construction of these trunk line should be of immense advantage materially and otherwise to china and should greatly facilitate the development of the bountiful resource of the empire on the other hand a large portion of these fund be to be expend for material american product have equal preference with those of the other three lending nation and as the contract provide for branch and extension subsequently to be build on the same term the opportunity for american material will reach considerable proportion

 know the interest of the united states in the reform of chinese currency the chinese government in the autumn of 1910 seek the assistance of the american government to procure fund with which to accomplish that all important reform in the course of the subsequent negotiation there be combine with the propose currency loan one for certain industrial development in manchuria the two loan aggregate the sum of $ 50,000,000 while this be originally to be solely an american enterprise the american government consistently with its desire to secure a sympathetic and practical cooperation of the great power toward maintain the principle of equality of opportunity and the administrative integrity of china urge the chinese government to admit to participation in the currency loan the associate of the american group in the hukuang loan while of immense importance in itself the reform contemplate in make this loan be but preliminary to other and more comprehensive fiscal reform which will be of incalculable benefit to china and foreign interest alike since they will strengthen the chinese empire and promote the rapid development of international trade

 neutral financial adviser

 when these negotiation be begin it be understand that a financial adviser be to be employ by china in connection with the reform and in order that absolute equality in all respect among the lending nation might be scrupulously observe the american government propose the nomination of a neutral adviser which be agree to by china and the other government concern on september 28 1911 dr. vissering president of the dutch java bank and a financier of wide experience in the orient be recommend to the chinese government for the post of monetary adviser

 especially important at the present when the ancient chinese empire be shake by civil war incidental to its awakening to the many influence and activity of modernization be the cooperative policy of good understanding which have be foster by the international project refer to above and the general sympathy of view among all the powers interested in the far east while safeguard the interest of our national this government be use its good effort in continuance of its traditional policy of sympathy and friendship toward the chinese empire and its people with the confident hope for their economic and administrative development and with the constant disposition to contribute to their welfare in all proper way consistent with an attitude of strict impartiality as between contend faction

 for the first time in the history of the two country a chinese cruiser the haichi under the command of admiral ching recently visit new york where the officer and man be give a cordial welcome
