 do at the city of washington this 18th day of may in the year of our lord 1917 and of the independence of the united states of america the one hundred and forty first
gentlemen of the congress eight month have elapse since i last have the honor of address you they have be month crowd with event of immense and grave significance for we i shall not undertake to detail or even to summarize those event the practical particular of the part we have play in they will be lay before you in the report of the executive department i shall discuss only our present outlook upon these vast affair our present duty and the immediate mean of accomplish the object we shall hold always in view i shall not go back to debate the cause of the war the intolerable wrong do and plan against we by the sinister master of germany have long since become too grossly obvious and odious to every true american to need to be rehearse but i shall ask you to consider again and with a very grave scrutiny our objective and the measure by which we mean to attain they for the purpose of discussion here in this place be action and our action must move straight toward definite end our object be of course to win the war and we shall not slacken or suffer ourselves to he divert until it be win but it be worth while ask and answer the question when shall we consider the war won?from one point of view it be not necessary to broach this fundamental matter i do not doubt that the american people know what the war be about and what sort of an outcome they will regard as a realization of their purpose in it as a nation we be unite in spirit and intention i pay little heed to those who tell i otherwise i hear the voice of dissent who do not i bear the criticism and the clamor of the noisily thoughtless and troublesome i also see man here and there fle themselves in impotent disloyalty against the calm indomitable power of the nation i hear man debate peace who understand neither its nature nor the way in which we may attain it with uplifted eye and unbroken spirit but i know that none of these speak for the nation they do not touch the heart of anything they may safely be leave to strut their uneasy hour and be forget but from another point of view i believe that it be necessary to say plainly what we here at the seat of action consider the war to be for and what part we mean to play in the settlement of its search issue we be the spokesman of the american people and they have a right to know whether their purpose be ours they desire peace by the overcoming of evil by the defeat once for all of the sinister force that interrupt peace and render it impossible and they wish to know how closely our thought run with theirs and what action we propose they be impatient with those who desire peace by any sort of compromisedeeply and indignantly impatient but they will be equally impatient with we if we do not make it plain to they what our objective be and what we be plan for in seek to make conquest of peace by arm i believe that i speak for they when i say two thing first that this intolerable thing of which the master of germany have show we the ugly face this menace of combined intrigue and force which we now see so clearly as the german power a thing without conscience or honor of capacity for covenanted peace must be crush and if it be not utterly bring to an end at least shut out from the friendly intercourse of the nation and second that when this thing and its power be indeed defeat and the time come that we can discuss peace when the german people have spokesman whose word we can believe and when those spokesman be ready in the name of their people to accept the common judgment of the nation as to what shall henceforth be the basis of law and of covenant for the life of the world we shall be willing and glad to pay the full price for peace and pay it ungrudgingly we know what that price will be it will be full impartial justice justice do at every point and to every nation that the final settlement must affect our enemy as well as our friend you catch with i the voice of humanity that be in the air they grow daily more audible more articulate more persuasive and they come from the heart of man everywhere they insist that the war shall not end in vindictive action of any kind that no nation or people shall be rob or punish because the irresponsible ruler of a single country have themselves do deep and abominable wrong it be this thought that have be express in the formula no annexation no contribution no punitive indemnity "just because this crude formula express the instinctive judgment as to right of plain man everywhere it have be make diligent use of by the master of german intrigue to lead the people of russia astrayand the people of every other country their agent could reach in order that a premature peace might be bring about before autocracy have be teach its final and convincing lesson and the people of the world put in control of their own destiny but the fact that a wrong use have be make of a just idea be no reason why a right use should not be make of it it ought to be bring under the patronage of its real friend let it be say again that autocracy must first be show the utter futility of its claim to power or leadership in the modern world it be impossible to apply any standard of justice so long as such force be unchecked and undefeated as the present master of germany command not until that have be do can right be set up as arbiter and peacemaker among the nation but when that have be do as god willing it assuredly will be we shall at last be free to do an unprecedented thing and this be the time to avow our purpose to do it we shall be free to base peace on generosity and justice to the exclusion of all selfish claim to advantage even on the part of the victor let there be no misunderstanding our present and immediate task be to win the war and nothing shall turn we aside from from it until it be accomplish every power and resource we possess whether of man of money or of material be be devote and will continue to be devoted to that purpose until it be achieve those who desire to bring peace about before that purpose be achieve i counsel to carry their advice elsewhere we will not entertain it we shall regard the war as win only when the german people say to we through properly accredit representative that they be ready to agree to a settlement base upon justice and reparation of the wrong their ruler have do they have do a wrong to belgium which must be repair they have establish a power over other land and people than their own over the great empire of austria hungary over hitherto free balkan state over turkey and within asia which must be relinquish germany 's success by skill by industry by knowledge by enterprise we do not grudge or oppose but admire rather she have build up for herself a real empire of trade and influence secure by the peace of the world we be content to abide by the rivalry of manufacture science and commerce that be involve for we in her success and stand or fall as we have or do not have the brain and the initiative to surpass she but at the moment when she have conspicuously win her triumph of peace she throw they away to establish in their stead what the world will no long permit to be gentleman of the congress
 once more as repeatedly before the spokesman of the central empires have indicate their desire to discuss the object of the war and the possible basis of a general peace parley have be in progress at brest litovsk between russian representative and representative of the central powers to which the attention of all the belligerent have be invite for the purpose of ascertain whether it may be possible to extend these parley into a general conference with regard to term of peace and settlement the russian representative present not only a perfectly definite statement of the principle upon which they would be willing to conclude peace but also an equally definite program of the concrete application of those principle the representative of the central powers on their part present an outline of settlement which if much less definite seem susceptible of liberal interpretation until their specific program of practical term be add that program propose no concession at all either to the sovereignty of russia or to the preference of the population with whose fortune it deal but mean in a word that the central empires be to keep every foot of territory their armed force have occupied,&mdash;every province every city every point of vantage,&mdash;as a permanent addition to their territory and their power it be a reasonable conjecture that the general principle of settlement which they at first suggest originate with the more liberal statesman of germany and austria the man who have begin to feel the force of their own peoples&#39 thought and purpose while the concrete term of actual settlement come from the military leader who have no thought but to keep what they have get the negotiation have be break off the russian representative be sincere and in earnest they can not entertain such proposal of conquest and domination
 the whole incident be full of significance it be also full of perplexity with whom be the russian representative deal for whom be the representative of the central empires speak be they speak for the majority of their respective parliament or for the minority party that military and imperialistic minority which have so far dominate their whole policy and control the affair of turkey and of the balkan state which have felt oblige to become their associate in this war the russian representative have insist very justly very wisely and in the true spirit of modern democracy that the conference they have be hold with the teutonic and turkish statesman should be hold within open not closed door and all the world have be audience as be desire to whom have we be listen then to those who speak the spirit and intention of the resolutions of the german reichstag of the ninth of july last the spirit and intention of the liberal leader and party of germany or to those who resist and defy that spirit and intention and insist upon conquest and subjugation or be we listen in fact to both unreconciled and in open and hopeless contradiction these be very serious and pregnant question upon the answer to they depend the peace of the world
 but whatever the result of the parley at brest litovsk whatever the confusion of counsel and of purpose in the utterance of the spokesman of the central empires they have again attempt to acquaint the world with their object in the war and have again challenge their adversary to say what their object be and what sort of settlement they would deem just and satisfactory there be no good reason why that challenge should not be respond to and respond to with the utmost candor we do not wait for it not once but again and again we have lay our whole thought and purpose before the world not in general term only but each time with sufficient definition to make it clear what sort of definitive term of settlement must necessarily spring out of they within the last week mr. lloyd george have speak with admirable candor and in admirable spirit for the people and government of great britain there be no confusion of counsel among the adversary of the central powers no uncertainty of principle no vagueness of detail the only secrecy of counsel the only lack of fearless frankness the only failure to make definite statement of the object of the war lie with germany and her allies the issue of life and death hang upon these definition no statesman who have the least conception of his responsibility ought for a moment to permit himself to continue this tragical and appalling outpouring of blood and treasure unless he be sure beyond a peradventure that the object of the vital sacrifice be part and parcel of the very life of society and that the people for whom he speak think they right and imperative as he do
 there be moreover a voice call for these definition of principle and of purpose which be it seem to i more thrilling and more compelling than any of the many move voice with which the troubled air of the world be fill it be the voice of the russian people they be prostrate and all but helpless it would seem before the grim power of germany which have hitherto know no relenting and no pity their power apparently be shatter and yet their soul be not subservient they will not yield either in principle or in action their conception of what be right of what it be humane and honorable for they to accept have be state with a frankness a largeness of view a generosity of spirit and a universal human sympathy which must challenge the admiration of every friend of mankind and they have refuse to compound their ideal or desert other that they themselves may be safe they call to we to say what it be that we desire in what if in anything our purpose and our spirit differ from theirs and i believe that the people of the united states would wish i to respond with utter simplicity and frankness whether their present leader believe it or not it be our heartfelt desire and hope that some way may be open whereby we may be privileged to assist the people of russia to attain their utmost hope of liberty and order peace
 it will be our wish and purpose that the process of peace when they be begin shall be absolutely open and that they shall involve and permit henceforth no secret understanding of any kind the day of conquest and aggrandizement be go by so be also the day of secret covenant enter into in the interest of particular government and likely at some unlooke for moment to upset the peace of the world it be this happy fact now clear to the view of every public man whose thought do not still linger in an age that be dead and go which make it possible for every nation whose purpose be consistent with justice and the peace of the world to avow now or at any other time the object it have in view
 we enter this war because violation of right have occur which touch we to the quick and make the life of our own people impossible unless they be correct and the world secure once for all against their recurrence what we demand in this war therefore be nothing peculiar to ourselves it be that the world be make fit and safe to live in and particularly that it be make safe for every peace love nation which like our own wish to live its own life determine its own institution be assure of justice and fair dealing by the other people of the world as against force and selfish aggression all the people of the world be in effect partner in this interest and for our own part we see very clearly that unless justice be do to other it will not be do to we the program of the world&#39;s peace therefore be our program and that program the only possible program as we see it be this
 i. open covenant of peace openly arrive at after which there shall be no private international understanding of any kind but diplomacy shall proceed always frankly and in the public view
 ii absolute freedom of navigation upon the sea outside territorial water alike in peace and in war except as the sea may be close in whole or in part by international action for the enforcement of international covenant
 iii the removal so far as possible of all economic barrier and the establishment of an equality of trade condition among all the nation consent to the peace and associate themselves for its maintenance
 iv adequate guarantee give and take that national armament will be reduce to the low point consistent with domestic safety
 v. a free open minded and absolutely impartial adjustment of all colonial claim base upon a strict observance of the principle that in determine all such question of sovereignty the interest of the population concern must have equal weight with the equitable claim of the government whose title be to be determine
 vi the evacuation of all russian territory and such a settlement of all question affect russia as will secure the good and free cooperation of the other nation of the world in obtain for she an unhampered and unembarrassed opportunity for the independent determination of her own political development and national policy and assure she of a sincere welcome into the society of free nation under institution of her own choosing and more than a welcome assistance also of every kind that she may need and may herself desire the treatment accord russia by her sister nation in the month to come will be the acid test of their good will of their comprehension of her need as distinguish from their own interest and of their intelligent and unselfish sympathy
 vii belgium the whole world will agree must be evacuate and restore without any attempt to limit the sovereignty which she enjoy in common with all other free nation no other single act will serve as this will serve to restore confidence among the nation in the law which they have themselves set and determine for the government of their relation with one another without this healing act the whole structure and validity of international law be forever impaired
 viii all french territory should be free and the invade portion restore and the wrong do to france by prussia in 1871 in the matter of alsace lorraine which have unsettle the peace of the world for nearly fifty year should be right in order that peace may once more be make secure in the interest of all
 ix a readjustment of the frontier of italy should be effect along clearly recognizable line of nationality
 x. the people of austria hungary whose place among the nation we wish to see safeguard and assure should be accord the free opportunity of autonomous development
 xi rumania serbia and montenegro should be evacuate occupy territory restore serbia accord free and secure access to the sea and the relation of the several balkan state to one another determine by friendly counsel along historically establish line of allegiance and nationality and international guarantee of the political and economic independence and territorial integrity of the several balkan state should be enter into
 xii the turkish portion of the present ottoman empire should be assure a secure sovereignty but the other nationality which be now under turkish rule should be assure an undoubted security of life and an absolutely unmolested opportunity of autonomous development and the dardanelles should be permanently open as a free passage to the ship and commerce of all nation under international guarantee
 xiii an independent polish state should be erect which should include the territory inhabit by indisputably polish population which should be assure a free and secure access to the sea and whose political and economic independence and territorial integrity should be guarantee by international covenant
 xiv a general association of nation must be form under specific covenant for the purpose of afford mutual guarantee of political independence and territorial integrity to great and small state alike
 in regard to these essential rectification of wrong and assertion of right we feel ourselves to be intimate partner of all the government and people associate together against the imperialists we can not be separate in interest or divide in purpose we stand together until the end
 for such arrangement and covenant we be willing to fight and to continue to fight until they be achieve but only because we wish the right to prevail and desire a just and stable peace such as can be secure only by remove the chief provocation to war which this program do remove we have no jealousy of german greatness and there be nothing in this program that impair it we grudge she no achievement or distinction of learn or of pacific enterprise such as have make her record very bright and very enviable we do not wish to injure she or to block in any way her legitimate influence or power we do not wish to fight she either with arm or with hostile arrangement of trade if she be willing to associate herself with we and the other peace love nation of the world in covenant of justice and law and fair dealing we wish she only to accept a place of equality among the people of the world,&mdash;the new world in which we now live,&mdash;instead of a place of mastery
 neither do we presume to suggest to she any alteration or modification of her institution but it be necessary we must frankly say and necessary as a preliminary to any intelligent dealing with she on our part that we should know whom her spokesman speak for when they speak to we whether for the reichstag majority or for the military party and the man whose creed be imperial domination
 we have speak now surely in term too concrete to admit of any further doubt or question an evident principle run through the whole program i have outline it be the principle of justice to all people and nationality and their right to live on equal term of liberty and safety with one another whether they be strong or weak unless this principle be make its foundation no part of the structure of international justice can stand the people of the united states could act upon no other principle and to the vindication of this principle they be ready to devote their life their honor and everything that they possess the moral climax of this the culminating and final war for human liberty have come and they be ready to put their own strength their own high purpose their own integrity and devotion to the test

gentlemen of the congress when i address myself to perform the duty lay upon the president by the constitution to present to you an annual report on the state of the union i find my thought dominate by an immortal sentence of abraham lincoln's-"let we have faith that right make might and in that faith let we dare to do our duty as we understand it -a sentence immortal because it embody in a form of utter simplicity and purity the essential faith of the nation the faith in which it be conceive and the faith in which it have grow to glory and power with that faith and the birth of a nation found upon it come the hope into the world that a new order would prevail throughout the affair of mankind an order in which reason and right would take precedence over covetousness and force and i believe that i express the wish and purpose of every thoughtful american when i say that this sentence mark for we in the plainest manner the part we should play alike in the arrangement of our domestic affair and in our exercise of influence upon the affair of the world by this faith and by this faith alone can the world be lift out of its present confusion and despair it be this faith be the faith with which our gallant man go into the field and out upon the sea to make sure of victory this be the mission upon which democracy come into the world democracy be an assertion of the right of the individual to live and to be treat justly as against any attempt on the part of any combination of individual to make law which will overburden he or which will destroy his equality among his fellow in the matter of right or privilege and i think we all realize that the day have come when democracy be be put upon its final test the old world be just now suffer from a wanton rejection of the principle of democracy and a substitution of the principle of autocracy as assert in the name but without the authority and sanction of the multitude this be the time of all other when democracy should prove its purity and its spiritual power to prevail it be surely the manifest destiny of the united states to lead in the attempt to make this spirit prevail there be two way in which the united states can assist to accomplish this great object first by offer the example within her own border of the will and power of democracy to make and enforce law which be unquestionably just and which be equal in their administration law which secure its full right to labor and yet at the same time safeguard the integrity of property and particularly of that property which be devoted to the development of industry and the increase of the necessary wealth of the world second by stand for right and justice as toward individual nation the law of democracy be for the protection of the the family of nation the united states can not refuse this role of champion without put the stigma of rejection upon the great and devoted man who bring its government into existence and establish it we in what we know as the war of 1812.i urge you to consider that the display of an immediate disposition on the part of the congress to remedy any injustice or evil that may have show themselves in have be exceedingly slow on the other side of the water and have give promise i venture to say of early completion only in our own fortunate country but even with we the recovery halt and be impede at time and there be immediately serviceable act of legislation which it seem to i we ought to attempt to assist that recovery and prove the indestructible recuperative force of a great government of the people one of these be to prove that a great democracy can keep house as successfully and in as business like a fashion as any other government it seem to i that the first step toward provide this be to supply ourselves with a systematic method of handle our estimate and expenditure and bring they to the point where they will not be an unnecessary strain upon our income or necessitate unreasonable taxation in other word a workable budget system and i respectfully suggest that two element be essential to such a system namely not only that the proposal of appropriation should be in the hand of a single body such as a single appropriation committee in each house of the congress but also that this body should be bring into such cooperation with the departments of the government and with the treasury of the united states as would enable it to act upon a complete conspectus of the need of the government and the resource from which it must draw its income i reluctantly veto the budget bill pass by the last session of the congress because of a constitutional objection the house of representatives subsequently modify the bill in order to meet this objection in the revise form i believe that the bill couple with action already take by the congress to revise its rule and procedure furnish the foundation for an effective national budget system i earnestly hope therefore that one of the first step to be take by the present session of the congress will be to pass the budget bill the nation 's finance have show mark improvement during the last year the total ordinary receipt of $ 6,694,000,000 for the fiscal year 1920 exceed those for 1919 by $ 1,542,000,000 while the total net ordinary expenditure decrease from $ 18,514,000,000 to $ 6,403,000,000 the gross public debt which reach its high point on august 31 1919 when it be $ 26,596,000,000 have drop on november 30 1920 to $ 24,175,000,000.there have also be a marked decrease in holding of government war security by the banking institution of the country as well as in the amount of bill hold by the federal reserve banks secure by government war obligation this fortunate result have relieve the bank and leave they free to finance the need of agriculture industry and commerce it have be due in large part to the reduction of the public debt especially of the float debt but more particularly to the improved distribution of government security among permanent investor the cessation of the government 's borrowing except through short term certificate of indebtedness have be a matter of great consequence to the people of the country at large as well as to the holder of liberty bonds and victory notes and have have an important bearing on the matter of effective credit control the year have be characterize by the progressive withdrawal of the treasury from the domestic credit market and from a position of dominant influence in that market the future course will necessarily depend upon the extent to which economy be practice and upon the burden place upon the treasury as well as upon industrial development and the maintenance of tax receipt at a sufficiently high level the fundamental fact which at present dominate the government 's financial situation be that seven and a half billion of its war indebtedness mature within the next two and a half year of this amount two and a half billion be float debt and five billion victory notes and war saving certificates the fiscal program of the government must be determine with reference to these maturity sound policy demand that government expenditure be reduce to the low amount which will permit the various service to operate efficiently and that government receipt from taxis and salvage be maintain sufficiently high to provide for current requirement include interest and sink fund charge on the public debt and at the same time retire the float debt and part of the victory loan before maturity with rigid economy vigorous salvage operation and adequate revenue from taxation a surplus of current receipt over current expenditure can be realize and should be apply to the float debt all branch of the government should cooperate to see that this program be realize i can not overemphasize the necessity of economy in government appropriation and expenditure and the avoidance by the congress of practice which take money from the treasury by indefinite or revolving fund appropriation the estimate for the present year show that over a billion dollar of expenditure be authorize by the last congress in addition to the amount show in the usual compile statement of appropriation this strikingly illustrate the importance of make direct and specific appropriation the relation between the current receipt and current expenditure of the government during the present fiscal year as well as during the last half of the last fiscal year have be disturb by the extraordinary burden throw upon the treasury by the transportation act in connection with the return of the railroad to private control over $ 600,000,000 have already be pay to the railroad under this act-$350,000,000 during the present fiscal limit the government 's progress in retire the float debt closely connect with this it seem to i be the necessity for an immediate consideration of the revision of our tax law simplification of the income and profit taxis have become an immediate necessity these taxis perform an indispensable service during the war the need for their simplification however be very great in order to save the taxpayer inconvenience and expense and in order to make his liability more certain and definite other and more detailed recommendation with regard to taxis will no doubt be lay before you by the secretary of the treasury and the commissioner of internal revenue it be my privilege to draw to the attention of congress for very sympathetic consideration the problem of provide adequate facility for the care and treatment of former member of the military and naval force who be sick and disabled as the result of their participation in the war these heroic man can never be pay in money for the service they patriotically render the nation their reward will lie rather in realization of the fact that they vindicate the right of their country and aid in safeguard civilization the nation 's gratitude must be effectively reveal to they by the most ample provision for their medical care and treatment as well as for their vocational training and placement the time have come when a more the treasury and the board for vocational education will outline in their annual report proposal cover medical care and rehabilitation which i be sure will engage your earnest study and commend your most generous support permit i to emphasize once more the need for action upon certain matter upon which i dwelt at some length in my message to the second session of the sixty sixth congress the necessity for example of encourage the manufacture of dyestuff and related chemical the importance of do everything possible to promote agricultural production along economic line to improve agricultural marketing and to make rural life more attractive and healthful the need for a law regulate cold storage in such a way as to limit the time during which good may be keep in storage prescribe the method of dispose of they if keep beyond the permit period and require good release from storage in all case to bear the date of their receipt it would also be most serviceable if it be provide that all good release from cold storage for interstate shipment should have plainly mark upon each package the selling or market price at which they go into storage in order that the purchaser might be able to learn what profit stand between he and the producer or the wholesale dealer indeed it would be very serviceable to the public if all good destine for interstate commerce be make to carry upon every packing case whose form make it possible a plain statement of the price at which they leave the hand of the producer i respectfully call your attention also to the recommendation of the message refer to with regard to a federal license for all corporation engage in interstate commerce in brief the immediate legislative need of the time be the removal of all obstacle to the realization of the good ambition of our people in their several class of employment and the strengthening of all instrumentality by which difficulty be to be meet and remove and justice deal out whether by law or by some form of mediation and conciliation i do not feel it to be my privilege at present to suggest the detailed and particular method by which these object may be attain but i have faith that the inquiry of your several committee will discover the way and the method in response to what i believe to be the impulse of sympathy and opinion throughout the united states i earnestly suggest that the congress authorize the treasury of the united states to make to the struggle government of armenia such a loan as be make to several of the allied government during the war and i would also suggest that it would be desirable to provide in the legislation itself that the expenditure of the money thus loan should be under the supervision of a commission or at least a commissioner from the united states in order that revolutionary tendency within armenia itself might not be afford by the loan a far tempting opportunity allow i to call your attention to the fact that the people of the philippine islands have succeed in maintain a stable government since the last action of the congress in their behalf and have thus fulfil the condition set by the congress as precedent to a consideration of grant independence to the islands i respectfully submit that this condition precedent having be fulfil it be now our liberty and our duty to keep our promise to the people of those island by grant they the independence which they so honorably covet i have not so much lay before you a series of recommendation gentleman as seek to utter a confession of faith of the faith in which i be breed and which it be my solemn purpose to stand by until my last fighting day i believe this to be the faith of america the faith of the future and of all the victory which await national action in the day to come whether in america or elsewhere
my countrymen

 when one survey the world about he after the great storm note the mark of destruction and yet rejoice in the ruggedness of the thing which withstand it if he be an american he breathe the clarified atmosphere with a strange mingling of regret and new hope we have see a world passion spend its fury but we contemplate our republic unshaken and hold our civilization secure liberty liberty within the law and civilization be inseparable and though both be threaten we find they now secure;and there come to americans the profound assurance that our representative government be the high expression and sure guaranty of both

 stand in this presence mindful of the solemnity of this occasion feel the emotion which no one may know until he sense the great weight of responsibility for himself i must utter my belief in the divine inspiration of the found father surely there must have be god 's intent in the making of this new world republic ours be an organic law which have but one ambiguity and we see that efface in a baptism of sacrifice and blood with union maintain the nation supreme and its concord inspire we have see the world rivet its hopeful gaze on the great truth on which the founder work we have see civil human and religious liberty verify and glorify in the beginning the old world scoff at our experiment;today our foundation of political and social belief stand unshaken a precious inheritance to ourselves an inspiring example of freedom and civilization to all mankind let we express renew and strengthen devotion in grateful reverence for the immortal beginning and utter our confidence in the supreme fulfillment

 the recorded progress of our republic materially and spiritually in itself prove the wisdom of the inherit policy of noninvolvement in oldworld affair confident of our ability to work out our own destiny and jealously guard our right to do so we seek no part in direct the destiny of the old world we do not mean to be entangle we will accept no responsibility except as our own conscience and judgment in each instance may determine

 our eye never will be blind to a develop menace our ear never deaf to the call of civilization we recognize the new order in the world with the close contact which progress have work we sense the call of the human heart for fellowship fraternity and cooperation we crave friendship and harbor no hate but america our america the america build on the foundation lay by the inspire father can be a party to no permanent military alliance it can enter into no political commitment nor assume any economic obligation which will subject our decision to any other than our own authority

 i be sure our own people will not misunderstand nor will the world misconstrue we have no thought to impede the path to close relationship we wish to promote understanding we want to do our part in make offensive warfare so hateful that government and people who resort to it must prove the righteousness of their cause or stand as outlaw before the bar of civilization

 we be ready to associate ourselves with the nation of the world great and small for conference for counsel to seek the express view of world opinion to recommend a way to approximate disarmament and relieve the crush burden of military and naval establishment we elect to participate in suggest plan for mediation conciliation and arbitration and would gladly join in that express conscience of progress which seek to clarify and write the law of international relationship and establish a world court for the disposition of such justiciable question as nation be agree to submit thereto in express aspiration in seek practical plan in translate humanity 's new concept of righteousness and justice and its hatred of war into recommend action we be ready most heartily to unite but every commitment must be make in the exercise of our national sovereignty since freedom impel and independence inspire and nationality exalt a world super government be contrary to everything we cherish and can have no sanction by our republic this be not selfishness it be sanctity it be not aloofness it be security it be not suspicion of other it be patriotic adherence to the thing which make we what we be

 today well than ever before we know the aspiration of humankind and share they we have come to a new realization of our place in the world and a new appraisal of our nation by the world the unselfishness of theseunited states be a thing prove our devotion to peace for ourselves and for the world be well establish our concern for preserve civilization have have its impassioned and heroic expression there be no american failure to resist the attempt reversion of civilization there will be no failure today or tomorrow

 the success of our popular government rest wholly upon the correct interpretation of the deliberate intelligent dependable popular will of america in a deliberate questioning of a suggest change of national policy where internationality be to supersede nationality we turn to a referendum to the american people there be ample discussion and there be a public mandate in manifest understanding

 america be ready to encourage eager to initiate anxious to participate in any seemly program likely to lessen the probability of war and promote that brotherhood of mankind which must be god 's high conception of human relationship because we cherish ideal of justice and peace because we appraise international comity and helpful relationship no less highly than any people of the world we aspire to a high place in the moral leadership of civilization and we hold a maintain america the proven republic the unshaken temple of representative democracy to be not only an inspiration and example but the high agency of strengthen good will and promote accord on both continent

 mankind need a world wide benediction of understanding it be need among individual among people among government and it will inaugurate an era of good feeling to make the birth of a new order in such understanding man will strive confidently for the promotion of their well relationship and nation will promote the comity so essential to peace

 we must understand that tie of trade bind nation in close intimacy and none may receive except as he give we have not strengthen ours in accordance with our resource or our genius notably on our own continent where a galaxy of republic reflect the glory of new world democracy but in the new order of finance and trade we mean to promote enlarged activity and seek expand confidence

 perhaps we can make no more helpful contribution by example than prove a republic 's capacity to emerge from the wreckage of war while the world 's embitter travail do not leave we devastate land nor desolate city leave no gape wound no breast with hate it do involve we in the delirium of expenditure in expand currency and credit in unbalanced industry in unspeakable waste and disturb relationship while it uncover our portion of hateful selfishness at home it also reveal the heart of america as sound and fearless and beat in confidence unfailing

 amid it all we have rivet the gaze of all civilization to the unselfishness and the righteousness of representative democracy where our freedom never have make offensive warfare never have seek territorial aggrandizement through force never have turn to the arbitrament of arm until reason have be exhaust when the government of the earth shall have establish a freedom like our own and shall have sanction the pursuit of peace as we have practice it i believe the last sorrow and the final sacrifice of international warfare will have be write

 let i speak to the maimed and wound soldier who be present today and through they convey to their comrade the gratitude of the republic for their sacrifice in its defense a generous country will never forget the service you render and you may hope for a policy under government that will relieve any maimed successor from take your place on another such occasion as this

 our supreme task be the resumption of our onward normal way reconstruction readjustment restoration all these must follow i would like to hasten they if it will lighten the spirit and add to the resolution with which we take up the task let i repeat for our nation we shall give no people just cause to make war upon we we hold no national prejudice we entertain no spirit of revenge we do not hate we do not covet we dream of no conquest nor boast of armed prowess

 if despite this attitude war be again force upon we i earnestly hope a way may be find which will unify our individual and collective strength and consecrate all america materially and spiritually body and soul to national defense i can vision the ideal republic where everyman and woman be call under the flag for assignment to duty for whatever service military or civic the individual be well fit where we may call to universal service every plant agency or facility all in the sublime sacrifice for country and not one penny of war profit shall inure to the benefit of private individual corporation or combination but all above the normal shall flow into the defense chest of the nation there be something inherently wrong something out of accord with the ideal of representative democracy when one portion of our citizenship turn its activity to private gain amid defensive war while another be fight sacrifice or die for national preservation

 out of such universal service will come a new unity of spirit and purpose a new confidence and consecration which would make our defense impregnable our triumph assure then we should have little or no disorganization of our economic industrial and commercial system at home no staggering war debt no swollen fortune to flout the sacrifice of our soldier no excuse for sedition no pitiable slackerism no outrage of treason envy and jealousy would have no soil for their menacing development and revolution would be without the passion which engender it

 a regret for the mistake of yesterday must not however blind we to the task of today war never leave such an aftermath there have be staggering loss of life and measureless wastage of material nation be still grope for return to stable way discourage indebtedness confront we like all the war tear nation and these obligation must be provide for no civilization can survive repudiation

 we can reduce the abnormal expenditure and we will we can strike at war taxation and we must we must face the grim necessity with full knowledge that the task be to be solve and we must proceed with a full realization that no statute enact by man can repeal the inexorable law of nature our most dangerous tendency be to expect too much of government and at the same time do for it too little we contemplate the immediatet ask of put our public household in order we need a rigid and yet sane economy combine with fiscal justice and it must be attend by individual prudence and thrift which be so essential to this try hour and reassure for the future

 the business world reflect the disturbance of war 's reaction herein flow the lifeblood of material existence the economic mechanism be intricate and its part interdependent and have suffer the shock and jar incident to abnormal demand credit inflation and price upheaval the normal balance have be impair the channel of distribution have be clog the relation of labor and management have be strain we must seek the readjustment with care and courage our people must give and take price must reflect the recede fever of war activity perhaps we never shall know the old level of wage again because war invariably readjust compensation and the necessary of life will show their inseparable relationship but we must strive for normalcy to reach stability all the penalty will not be light nor evenly distribute there be no way of make they so there be no instant step from disorder to order we must face a condition of grim reality charge off our loss and start afresh it be the old lesson of civilization i would like government to do all it can to mitigate then in understanding in mutuality of interest in concern for the common good our task will be solve no altered system will work a miracle any wild experiment will only add to the confusion our good assurance lie in efficient administration of our proven system

 the forward course of the business cycle be unmistakable people be turn from destruction to production industry have sense the change order and our own people be turn to resume their normal onward way the call be for productive america to go on i know that congress and theadministration will favor every wise government policy to aid the resumption and encourage continue progress

 i speak for administrative efficiency for lightened tax burden for sound commercial practice for adequate credit facility for sympathetic concern for all agricultural problem for the omission of unnecessary interference of government with business for an end to government 's experiment in business and for more efficient business in government administration with all of this must attend a mindfulness of the human side of all activity so that social industrial and economic justice will be square with the purpose of a righteous people

 with the nation wide induction of womanhood into our political life we may count upon her intuition her refinement her intelligence and her influence to exalt the social order we count upon her exercise of the full privilege and the performance of the duty of citizenship to speed the attainment of the high state

 i wish for an america no less alert in guard against danger from within than it be watchful against enemy from without our fundamental law recognize no class no group no section there must be none in legislation or administration the supreme inspiration be the common weal humanity hunger for international peace and we crave it with all mankind my most reverent prayer for america be for industrial peace with its reward widely and generally distribute amid the inspiration of equal opportunity no one justly may deny the equality of opportunity which make we what we be we have mistake unpreparedness to embrace it to be a challenge of the reality and due concern for make all citizen fit for participation will give add strength of citizenship and magnify our achievement

 if revolution insist upon overturn establish order let other people make the tragic experiment there be no place for it in america when world war threaten civilization we pledge our resource and our life to its preservation and when revolution threaten we unfurl the flag of law and order and renew our consecration ours be a constitutional freedom where the popular will be the law supreme and minority be sacredly protect our revision reformation and evolution reflect a deliberate judgment and an orderly progress and we mean to cure our ill but never destroy or permit destruction by force

 i have rather submit our industrial controversy to the conference table in advance than to a settlement table after conflict and suffering the earth be thirst for the cup of good will understanding be its fountain source i would like to acclaim an era of good feeling amid dependable prosperity and all the blessing which attend

 it have be prove again and again that we can not while throw our market open to the world maintain american standard of living and opportunity and hold our industrial eminence in such unequal competition there isa lure fallacy in the theory of banish barrier of trade but preservedamerican standard require our high production cost to be reflect in our tariff on import today as never before when people be seek trade restoration and expansion we must adjust our tariff to the new order we seek participation in the world 's exchange because therein lie our way to widen influence and the triumph of peace we know full well we can not sell where we do not buy and we can not sell successfully where we do not carry opportunity be call not alone for the restoration but for a new era in production transportation and trade we shall answer it well by meet the demand of a surpass home market by promote self- reliance in production and by bid enterprise genius and efficiency to carry our cargo in american bottom to the mart of the world

 we would not have an america live within and for herself alone butwe would have her self reliant independent and ever nobler strong and rich believe in our high standard rear through constitutionalliberty and maintain opportunity we invite the world to the same height but pride in thing work be no reflex of a complete task common welfareis the goal of our national endeavor wealth be not inimical to welfare;it ought to be its friendly agency there never can be equality of rewardsor possession so long as the human plan contain varied talent and differingdegree of industry and thrift but ours ought to be a country free fromthe great blotch of distressed poverty we ought to find a way to guardagainst the peril and penalty of unemployment we want an america ofhome illumine with hope and happiness where mother free from thenecessity for long hour of toil beyond their own door may preside asbefit the hearthstone of american citizenship we want the cradle of americanchildhood rock under condition so wholesome and so hopeful that no blightmay touch it in its development and we want to provide that no selfishinterest no material necessity no lack of opportunity shall prevent thegaining of that education so essential to good citizenship

 there be no short cut to the making of these ideal into glad reality the world have witness again and again the futility and the mischief ofill consider remedy for social and economic disorder but we be mindfultoday as never before of the friction of modern industrialism and we mustlearn its cause and reduce its evil consequence by sober and tested method where genius have make for great possibility justice and happiness mustbe reflect in a great common welfare

 service be the supreme commitment of life i would rejoice to acclaimthe era of the golden rule and crown it with the autocracy of service i pledge an administration wherein all the agency of government be calledto serve and ever promote an understanding of government purely as anexpression of the popular will

 one can not stand in this presence and be unmindful of the tremendousresponsibility the world upheaval have add heavily to our task butwith the realization come the surge of high resolve and there be reassurancein belief in the god give destiny of our republic if i feel that thereis to be sole responsibility in the executive for the america of tomorrowi should shrink from the burden but here be a hundred million withcommon concern and shared responsibility answerable to god and country the republic summon they to their duty and i invite co operation

 i accept my part with single mindedness of purpose and humility of spirit and implore the favor and guidance of god in his heaven with these i amunafraid and confidently face the future

 i have take the solemn oath of office on that passage of holy writwherein it be ask what doth the lord require of thee but to do justly and to love mercy and to walk humbly with thy god this i plight to godand country

my countryman the pioneer to whom i have oftentime allude these stalwart maker of america could have no conception of our present day attainment hamilton who conceive and washington who sponsor little dreamed of either a development or a solution like our of today but they be right in fundamental they know what be safe and preach security one may doubt if either of they if any of the founder would wish america to hold aloof from the world but there have come to we lately a new realization of the menace to our america in european entanglement which emphasize the prudence of washington though he could little have dream the thought which be in my mind

 when i sit on the senate committee on foreign relations and listen to american delegation appeal in behalf of kinsman or old home folk across the sea i catch the aspiration of nationality and the perfectly natural sympathy among kindre in this republic but i little realize then how we might rend the concord of american citizenship in our seek to solve old world problem there have come to i not at all unbecomingly the express anxiety of americans foreign bear who be ask our country 's future attitude on territorial award in the adjustment of peace they be americans all but they have a proper and a natural interest in the fortune of kinsfolk and native land one can not blame they if our land be to settle the envy rivalry jealousy and hatred of all civilization these adopt son of the republic want the settlement favorable to the land from which they come

 the misfortune be not alone that it rend the concord of nation the great pity be that it rend the concord of our citizenship at home it be folly to think of blend greek and bulgar italian and slovak or make any of they rejoicingly american when the land of adoption sit in judgement on the land from which he come we need to be rescue from divisionary and fruitless pursuit of peace through supergovernment i do not want americans of foreign birth make their party alignment on what we mean to do for some nation in the old world we want they to be republican because of what we mean to do for the united states of america our call be for unison not rival sympathy our need be concord not the antipathy of long inheritance

 surely no one stop to think where the great world experiment be lead frankly no one could know we be only learn now it would be a sorry day for this republic if we allow our activity in seek for peace in the old world to blind we to the essential of peace at home we want a free america again we want america free at home and free in the world we want to silence the outcry of nation against nation in the fullness of understanding and we wish to silence the cry of class against class and stifle the party appeal to class so that we may ensure tranquility in our own freedom if i could choose but one i have rather have industrial and social peace at home than command the international peace of all the world

there grow on i the realization of the unusual character of this occasion our republic have be at war before it have ask and receive the supreme sacrifice of its son and daughter and faith in america have be justify many son and daughter make the sublime offering and go to hallowed grave as the nation s defender but we never before send so many to battle under the flag in foreign land never before be there the impressive spectacle of thousand of dead return to find eternal resting place in the beloved homeland the incident be without parallel in history that i know

 these dead know nothing of our ceremony today they sense nothing of the sentiment or the tenderness which bring their waste body to the homeland for burial close to kin and friend and cherished association these poor body be but the clay tenement once possess of soul which flame in patriotic devotion light new hope on the battle ground of civilization and in their sacrifice speed on to accuse autocracy before the court of eternal justice

 we be not meet for they though we love and honor and speak a grateful tribute it would be futile to speak to those who do not hear or to sorrow for those who can not sense it or to exalt those who can not know but we can speak for country we can reach those who sorrow and sacrifice through their service who suffer through their going who glory with the republic through their heroic achievement who rejoice in the civilization their heroism preserve every funeral every memorial every tribute be for the living an offering in compensation of sorrow when the light of life go out there be a new radiance in eternity and somehow the glow of it relieve the darkness which be leave behind

 never a death but somewhere a new life never a sacrifice but somewhere an atonement never a service but somewhere and somehow an achievement these have serve which be the supreme inspiration in living they have earn everlasting gratitude which be the supreme solace in die

 no one may measure the vast and varied affection and sorrow center on this priceless cargo of bodies-- once live fight for and finally die for the republic one s word fail his understanding be halt his emotion be stir beyond control when contemplate these thousand of beloved dead i find a hundred thousand sorrow touch my heart and there be ring in my ear like an admonition eternal an insistent call it must not be again it must not be again god grant that it will not be and let a practical people join in cooperation with god to the end that it shall not be

 i would not wish a nation for which man be not willing to fight and if need be to die but i do wish for a nation where it be not necessary to ask that sacrifice i do not pretend that millennial day have come but i can believe in the possibility of a nation be so righteous as never to make a war of conquest and a nation so powerful in righteousness that none will dare invoke her wrath i wish for we such an america these hero be sacrifice in the supreme conflict of all human history they see democracy challenge and defend it they see civilization threaten and rescue it they see america affront and resent it they see our nation s right imperil and stamp those right with a new sanctity and renew security



 they give all which man and woman can give we shall give our most and well if we make certain that they do not die in vain we shall not forget no matter whether they lie amid the sweetness and the bloom of the homeland or sleep in the soil they crimson our mindfulness our gratitude our reverence shall be in the preserved republic and maintain liberty and the supreme justice for which they die

gentleman of the conference the united states welcome you with unselfish hand we harbor no fear we have no sordid end to serve we suspect no enemy we contemplate or apprehend no conquest content with what we have we seek nothing which be another s we only wish to do with you that fine nobler thing which no nation can do alone

 criticism of the railroad law have be direct first to the section lay down the rule by which rate be fix and provide for payment to the government and use of excess earning second to the method for the adjustment of wage scale and third to the authority permit consolidation

 education and welfare

 our national government be not do as much as it legitimately can do to promote the welfare of the people our enormous material wealth our institution our whole form of society can not be consider fully successful until their benefit reach the merit of every individual this be not a suggestion that the government should or could assume for the people the inevitable burden of existence there be no method by which we can either be relieve of the result of our own folly or be guarantee a successful life there be an inescapable personal responsibility for the development of character of industry of thrift and of self control these do not come from the government but from the people themselves but the government can and should always be expressive of steadfast determination always vigilant to maintain condition under which these virtue be most likely to develop and secure recognition and reward this be the american policy

 it be in accordance with this principle that we have enact law for the protection of the public health and have adopt prohibition in narcotic drug and intoxicate liquor for purpose of national uniformity we ought to provide by constitutional amendment and appropriate legislation for a limitation of child labor and in all case under the exclusive jurisdiction of the federal government a minimum wage law for woman which would undoubtedly find sufficient power of enforcement in the influence of public opinion

 have in mind that education be peculiarly a local problem and that it should always be pursue with the large freedom of choice by student and parent nevertheless the federal government might well give the benefit of its counsel and encouragement more freely in this direction if anyone doubt the need of concerted action by the states of the nation for this purpose it be only necessary to consider the appalling figure of illiteracy represent a condition which do not vary much in all part of the union i do not favor the making of appropriation from the national treasury to be expend directly on local education but i do consider it a fundamental requirement of national activity which accompany by allied subject of welfare be worthy of a separate department and a place in the cabinet the humanitarian side of government should not be repress but should be cultivate

 the report of the coal commission will be before the congress it comprise all the fact it represent the mature deliberation and conclusion of the good talent and experience that ever make a national survey of the production and distribution of fuel i do not favor government ownership or operation of coal mine the need be for action under private ownership that will secure great continuity of production and great public protection the federal government probably have no peacetime authority to regulate wage price or profit in coal at the mine or among dealer but by ascertain and publishing fact it can exercise great influence

of other nation we shall do well to be little impress by such report or such action any nation undertake to maintain a military establishment with aggressive and imperialistic design will find itself severely handicap in the economic development of the world i believe thoroughly in the army and navy in adequate defense and preparation but i be oppose to any policy of competition in build and maintain land or sea armament our country have definitely relinquish the old standard of deal with other country by terror and force and be definitely committed to the new standard of deal with they through friendship and understanding this new policy should be constantly keep in mind by the guide force of the army and navy by the congress and by the country at large i believe it hold a promise of great benefit to humanity i shall resist any attempt to resort to the old method and the old standard i be especially solicitous that foreign nation should comprehend the candor and sincerity with which we have adopt this position while we propose to maintain defensive and supplementary police force by land and sea and to train they through inspection and maneuver upon appropriate occasion in order to maintain their efficiency i wish every other nation to understand that this do not express any unfriendliness or convey any hostile intent i want the armed force of america to be consider by all people not as enemy but as friend as the contribution which be make by this country for the maintenance of the peace and security of the world veteran with the authorization for general hospitalization of the veteran of all war provide during the present year the care and treatment of those who have serve their country in time of peril and the attitude of the government toward they solicitous consideration oil the part of their fellow citizen they be organize in various association of which the chief and most representative be the american legion through its officer the legion will present to the congress numerous suggestion for legislation they cover such a wide variety of subject that it be impossible to discuss they within the scope of this message with many of the proposal i join in hearty approval and commend they all to the sympathetic investigation and consideration of the congress foreign relation at no period in the past 12 year have our foreign relation be in such a satisfactory condition as they be at the present time our action in the recent month have greatly strengthen the american policy of permanent peace with independence the attitude which our government take and maintain toward an adjustment of european reparation by point out that it wit not a political but a business problem have demonstrate its wisdom by its actual result we desire to see europe restore that it may resume its productivity in the increase of industry and its support in the advance of civilization we look with great gratification at the hopeful prospect of recuperation in europe through the dawes plan such assistance as can be give through the action of the public authority and of our private citizen through friendly counsel and cooperation and through economic and financial support not for any warlike effort but for reproductive enterprise not to provide mean for unsound government financing but to establish sound business administration should be unhesitatingly provide ultimately nation like individual can not depend upon each other but must depend upon themselves each one must work out its own salvation we have every desire to help but with all our resource we be powerless to save unless our effort meet with a constructive response the situation in our own country and all over the world be one chat can be improve only by bard work and self denial it be necessary to reduce expenditure increase saving and liquidate debt it be in this direction that there lie the great hope of domestic tranquility and international peace our own country ought to finish the lead example in this effort our past adherence to this policy our constant refusal to maintain a military establishment that could be think to menace the security of other our honorable dealing with other nation whether great or small have leave we in the almost constant enjoyment of peace it be not necessary to stress the general desire of all the people of this country for the promotion of peace it be the lead principle of all our foreign relation we have on every occasion try to cooperate to this end in all way that be consistent with our proper independence and our traditional policy it will be my constant effort to maintain these principle and to reinforce they by all appropriate agreement and treaty while we desire always to cooperate and to help we be equally determined to be independent and free right and truth and justice and humanitarian effort will have the moral support of this country all over the world but we do not wish to become involved in the political controversy of other nor be the country dispose to become a member of the league of nations or to assume the obligation impose by its covenant international court america have be one of the foremost nation in advocate tribunal for the settlement of international dispute of a justiciable character our representative take a leading in those conference which result in the establishment of e ague tribunal and later in provide for a permanent court of international justice i believe it would be for the advantage of this country and helpful to the stability of other nation for we to adhere to the protocol establishing that court upon the condition state in the recommendation which be now before the senate and far that our country shall not be bind by advisory opinion which may be render by the court upon question which we have not voluntarily submit for its judgment this court would provide a practical and convenient tribunal before which we could go voluntarily but to which we could not be summon for a determination of justiciable question when they fail to be resolve by diplomatic negotiation disarmament conference many time i have express my desire to see the work of the washington conference on limitation of armaments appropriately supplement by further agreement for a further reduction m for the purpose of diminish the menace and waste of the competition in prepare instrument of international war it have be and be my expectation that we might hopefully approach other great power for further conference on this subject as soon as the carrying out of the present reparation plan as the established and settle policy of europe have create a favorable opportunity but on account of proposal which have already be make by other government for a european conference it will be necessary to wait to see what the outcome of their action may be i should not wish to propose or have representative attend a conference which would contemplate commitment oppose to the freedom of action we desire to maintain unimpaired with respect to our purely domestic policy international law our country should also support effort which be be make toward and member of international law institute and society than to a conference of those who be technically representative of their respective government although when project have be develop they must go to the government for their approval these expert professional study be go on in certain quarter and should have our constant encouragement and approval outlaw of war much interest have of late be manifest in this country in the discussion of various proposal to outlaw aggressive war i look with great sympathy upon the examination of this subject it be in harmony with the traditional policy of our country which be against aggressive war and for the maintenance of permanent and honorable peace while as i have say we must safeguard our liberty to deal accord to our own judgment with our domestic policy we can not fail to view with sympathetic interest all progress to this desire end or carefully to study the measure that may be propose to attain it latin america while we be desirous of promote peace in every quarter of the globe we have a special interest in the peace of this hemisphere it be our constant desire that all cause of dispute in this area may be tranquilly and satisfactorily adjust along with our desire for peace be the earnest hope for the increase prosperity of our sister republic of latin america and our constant purpose to promote cooperation with they which may be mutually beneficial and always inspire by the most cordial friendship foreign debt about $ 12,000,000,000 be due to our government from abroad mostly from european government great britain finland hungary lithuania and poland have negotiate settlement amount close to $ 5,000,000,000 this represent the funding of over 42 per cent of the debt since the creation of the special foreign debt commission as the life of this commission be about to expire its term should be extend i be oppose to the cancellation of these debt and believe it for the good welfare of the world that they should be liquidate and pay as fast as possible i do not favor oppressive measure but unless money that be borrow be repay credit can not be secure in time of necessity and there exist besides a moral obligation which our country can not ignore and no other country can evade term and condition may have to conform to difference in the financial ability of the country concern but the principle that each country should meet its obligation admit of no difference and be of universal application it be axiomatic that our country can not stand still it would seem to be perfectly plain from recent event that it be determined to go forward but it want no pretense it want no vagary it be determined to advance in an orderly sound and common sense way it do not propose to abandon the theory of the declaration that the people have inalienable right which no majority and no power of government can destroy it do not propose to abandon the practice of the constitution that provide for the protection of these right it believe that within these limitation which be impose not by the fiat of man but by the law of the creator self government be just and wise it be convince that it will be impossible for the people to provide their own government unless they continue to own their own property these be the very foundation of america on they have be erect a government of freedom and equality of justice and mercy of education and charity live under it and support it the people have come into great possession on the material and spiritual side of life i want to continue in this direction i know that the congress share with i that desire i want our institution to be more and more expressive of these principle i want the people of all the earth to see in the american flag the symbol of a government which intend no oppression at home and no aggression abroad which in the spirit of a common brotherhood provide assistance in time of distress
